1533.content:
You finally got the promotion you had been hoping for. It came with a huge pay raise and added benefits. It was amazing, it came with included living expenses and even clothing allowances. You had just been transferred to the police force's undercover department. You showed up for your first day on the job excited for what your first assignment could possibly be. You knock on the chiefs office and he invites you in.

He explains your situation. "Now agent, we have specifically chosen you for this assignment based on the file we had received for you. I will be showing you the assignments and you get to pick from one. Keep in mind even looking at these assignments is a 100% commitment to this operation. For security reasons once you see the offers you cannot decline. Sign this paper understanding you've read it. Remember, there is absolutely no backing out. You must perform every task thrown at you as if you were the the person you're replacing themselves." You quickly sign the paper without even reading it.

"Now agent, here are the bios of three women that you would be suitable to replace." He stated.

"Wait woman?! I thought I would be disguised as a man!" You exclaimed.

"No, we never specified that. Remember the contract. It is too late now." He said calmly. You had to accept, you didn't have much choice, but you had a feeling you were gonna have a terrible life for a few days.

"We have a scientist that has created a completely safe procedure to transform you. We kidnap and keep the person you are replacing. We then extract their DNA and through a procedure impose it on your body. Perfectly harmless. Now here are the 3 women you can choose from. One is Katherine Adams. She is the wife of a man we suspect of being the leader of an organized crime ring. You know, gang leader and such. The other is Madison Adams. She is the teenage daughter of the aforementioned crime leader. The last one is Layla Thomas. We don't know who she is. All we know is she is a fairly important member in one if the crime leader's, err, businesses. Which do you pick?"

Still crushed from the shock of what had just happened, you flip through the three bios

Katherine Adams (wife)
25
Tall attractive brunette woman
Not much is know about her actions

Madison Adams (daughter)
17
Average height blonde girl, extremely attractive with a slender build
Attends high school, fairly popular

Layla Thomas (strip club dancer and performer, chief hides this from you)
21
Tall woman with perky boobs and a skinny frame
The most attractive one out of the batch

Which do you pick?

15432.content:
“He was definitely a fraud.”

Oh, how you’d come to regret those words. After your friends had dragged you to a hypnotism show, you had been less than impressed. The people up there had obviously been acting. Hypnotism wasn’t real, and you weren’t budging on that stance.

Still, your friends had insisted on staying in the lobby to argue over the matter.

“There’s no way that was fake! The girl would’ve jumped right off the stage trying to fly if he hadn’t stopped her.”

You roll your eyes at Jane’s comment, despite her boyfriend, Louis, nodding in agreement.

“Just admit you were wrong,” Jake chimes in, nudging you in the side.

“He’s too stubborn to admit it,” Josh adds, and you grimace at him.

“I’m not going to lie and say you guys were right to make you feel better. He is definitely a fraud.” Sarah pouts at your words, but you roll your eyes.

“A fraud, you say?” The new voice causes all five of you to spin around on your heels, only to come face to face with the hypnotist himself. You wince, feeling a little bad for trashtalking him, but it was the truth, right? He had to expect someone logical to call him out when he went around claiming to really hypnotize his audiences. “Say, would...”

“Uh...” Before you can even respond, your friends shove you towards him.

“Take him,” Sarah says with a wicked grin at you, obviously hoping you’ll get your just desserts.

Casting a pleading look at your unmoved friends, you follow the hypnotist back to his room. No doubt he was about to ask you to keep his secret for him, right?

You enter his backstage office with a grimace. It’s actually pretty nice. He asks if you want a drink, and once you decline, says you can sit down on his couch.

You don’t remember what happened after that; it feels as if everything went black. When you wake up...
154322.title: “...you come back to my room with me?”

1543221.content:
You open you eyes slowly, seeing the ceiling of... the hypnotist's dressing room? You remembered going in there but...

You sat up and saw the hypnotist looking over a stack of papers in his hands. When he notices, he smiles at you.

"Ah, you're awake." he said.

"What happened?" you asked.

"We had a nice discussion about your problems with my act, and I figured out an arrangement that we could both benefit from."

"Arrangement?"

"Yes, your desire to get definitive proof of my abilities, and my desire to spice up my act with something new." he pointed to the stack of papers.

"What are those?"

"A contract, stating that you're bound to be my assistant for the next six months of shows in the tri-state area, with an option to renew, should you decide you like the work and want to go on tour with me."

"Fat chance." you muttered. "But I don't remember..."

"It's been a long night. We've already exchanged information, so I'll just send you the list of shows and you just ensure that you show up, all right?"

"...Okay?" you replied.

You weren't really sure how to take this, and you weren't looking for a job as a hypnotist's assistant, but this would be the best chance to catch onto how he cheats the audience.

After shaking hands, you left the dressing room and returned to where your friends were.

"How long have I been gone?" you asked.

"Not long, maybe a half hour?" Sarah replied. "Did he hypnotize you?"

"Hardly! But I'm going to get proof of how he really does his bits."

You explained your new arrangement to your friends. They simply laughed and told you to be careful that he doesn't hypnotize you without you knowing as you left the lobby and headed for home.
1543221.title: ...he’a holding a contract up you don’t rem...

choices: You're back on the dressing room couch after the show
You're in the middle of the show
15432211.content:
The next day, the hypnotist, whose name was "The Amazing Alfred", had sent you the entire schedule, featuring shows at nearby theaters. With the time to reflect, you were having doubts about this new arrangement, but you had signed a contract, and how long can six months really be?

The next show was at the same venue in the late afternoon, and you figured you'd show up a tad early, to scope the place out, see if you'd get to meet his other audience plants. You figured that you'd be forced to pretend to be hypnotized and act like an idiot, probably revenge for your comments, but at least you'd know he was a fraud.

Arriving at the venue, the Amazing Alfred met you backstage.

"Ah, there you are. I feared you might not show." he said.

"Fat chance. So, where are the other plants?"

"As I keep telling you, there are no plants. But we've got some hang time, so why don't you take a seat in the dressing room while I set up?" Alfred suggested.

"Sounds good." you walked to the dressing room, intent on searching the place, to figure out his deal, while he remained behind to set up the stage.

You looked around the room, which featured some chairs, a couch, and a portable closet. Looking inside, you found a garment bag and a shoebox. Both appeared full, even though Alfred was already in full costume.

"Is he expecting me to wear a suit?" you asked out loud.

You had worn a sweater and jeans, not expecting a wardrobe change. As you reached for the garment bag, Alfred popped up behind you.

"A nosy one, aren't you? Well, I suppose it's all right, you'll be spending an awful lot of time in the dressing room with me, you might as well get acquainted with everything." Alfred said.

"Is that for me?" you asked, motioning to the garment bag.

"Oh, no, that's a leftover from my former assistant. They left suddenly and didn't take the outfit. I'm keeping it around in case they ask for it back, but so far, they haven't." Alfred said. "By the way, purple polka-dotted orangutan."

Suddenly, your eyes felt heavy and in the blink of an eye, you were no longer standing near the closet. You were instead...
15432211.title: The next day

154322111.content:
Your vision adjusted, and like a jarring cut in a movie between two distinct scenes, you were suddenly staring up at the ceiling like you had been after signing the contract. You sat up and looked around, finding the room empty once more.

"Where did he?" you asked.

You looked yourself up and down and found nothing amiss, same sweater and jeans you had arrived in. Checking your watch revealed that over two hours had passed since you arrived! Did you black out? While you wondered, Alfred returned to the dressing room.

"Ah, there you are! Wonderful show, eh?" he asked.

The show was over already? And you didn't remember anything? Could he have... No! Hypnosis is fake! You probably just blacked out... but didn't Alfred say something before you woke up on the couch? Why couldn't you remember?

"Alex?" Alfred asked. "Are you all right?"

"Of course, I am!" you replied.

Can't let him know about the doubts you have. This entire exercise is to prove him a fraud!

"So you agree it was a great show?"

"Yeah, it was great. I had a lot of fun."

"And are you any closer to proving your theory?"

"If I told you, that'd be cheating."

Alfred simply smiled and went back to packing up the dressing room.

"Our next show is in two days. I'll give you the check for this performance then."

"I get paid?"

"Of course, you did read the contract before signing, right?"

"Yeah, I'm not stupid." you said, even if you didn't exactly remember reading it, but you must've.

As you walked back to your car, you pondered that new information. You didn't necessarily need the money, you did pretty steady freelance web design work, but if he was paying you as you undermined his act, it seemed a pretty one-sided agreement in your favor, so the contract must've been fair.

Arriving at home, you stripped out of your clothes, only to find a worrying sight. All of your body hair, below the neck, had fallen out! Or shaved, the circumstances of the loss, you weren't clear on. What you were clear on, was that the loss happened during the seeming blackout time. What could that mean?

"Am I getting sick?" you wondered aloud. "Or did the hypnosis do this?"

You smacked yourself for even considering that hypnosis was real. You'd have to check on it, see how or if it grows back, and if it gets worrisome, have a doctor check it out. For now, you wanted to sleep, your feet were killing you!
154322111.title: You're back on the dressing room couch afte...

1543221111.content:
The next morning, you woke up, had a quick breakfast and got to work on some designs for a few clients. It was a rather ordinary day, save for the fact that your newly smooth skin was chafing terribly against your clothes. Not enough to cause alarm, but enough to be super uncomfortable.

While taking a lunch break, you got the sudden idea to do a Google search for "The Amazing Alfred", and looked up recordings of past shows. The one from a few days ago was fresh in your mind, and you assumed he'd done the same show last night, but you remembered the garment bag, and Alfred's comments.

"That's a leftover from my former assistant. They left suddenly and didn't take the outfit. I'm keeping it around in case they ask for it back, but so far, they haven't."Alfred said.

"Say..." you remarked to yourself. "If anyone would know his secrets, it'd be a former assistant."

You started to search around for recordings that featured an assistant, finding a video dated roughly a year earlier, featuring a blonde woman in a slinky, sparkly black dress, fishnets and heels, identified in the description as Nikki.

The video was basically what you had seen with your friends, with the exception of Nikki acting as a go-between, and participating in a few segments with the chosen audience members, in the case of this show, doing the tango with one, and leading another around like a puppy.

Is that what you had done last night? And why did you have so much trouble recalling it? The more you thought about it, the more you felt at ease, so you eventually got back to work.

Once you were done for the day, you got a group text from Sarah, asking the group to meet for drinks, and you quickly accepted.
1543221111.title: The next day

15432211111.content:
Arriving at the bar, you quickly found your friends and sat down with them, catching up on the day's events before their inevitable questions started.

"How was your show with 'The Amazing Alfred'?" Sarah asked.

"Pretty good... I think." you replied.

"Figure out all his secrets yet?" Josh asked.

"Not yet, he's keeping things pretty close to his chest, but once I observe him more, I'll catch him." you replied.

"Can't you just admit that it's a fun show?" Jane asked.

"What's fun about dishonesty?" you retorted.

"Give it a rest, babe. He's a lost cause." Louis added.

Once the matter was settled, the conversations became more specialized, and you felt uncomfortable again, so you shifted in your seat.

"What's wrong?" Sarah asked. "You've been doing that all night."

"Have I?" you asked. "It's... actually, can you keep a secret?"

"Sure." Sarah leaned in close. "What's up?"

"I don't know how, but after the show last night, all my body hair was gone." you whispered.

"It fell out?" Sarah asked.

"I'm not sure yet." you replied.

"Do you think he hypnotized you into shaving it?"

"Of course not! Hypnosis isn't real!" you insisted. "But since you do shave, do you have any recommendations for clothes that don't chafe?"

"Honestly? Softer material is better, cotton, silk, maybe try a softer fabric than jeans if it's your legs bothering you." Sarah recommended. "Sweatpants, maybe?"

After taking some notes on her recommendations, you both returned to the main conversation before the night ended. But you'd have to see if you had time to shop for some new threads before the next show.
15432211111.title: Meeting up with the gang

154322111111.content:
The next day, the chafing was getting even more irritating, and you knew you wouldn't be able to stand doing the show if you were constantly shifting around, so you made the time for some shopping beforehand. Heading out to the mall, you quickly headed into the nearest clothing store, checking out the Men's department.

"Let's see, cotton, silk... let's see." you browsed.

There was no shortage of soft items, and you grabbed a pile of them to check in the changing room. No sense in spending money on clothes that might not even solve the problem, even if you'd be getting a paycheck tonight.

Lo and behold, that's exactly what happened, and even the softest men's shirt and pants still caused you to chafe. After carrying the bundle of clothes out and putting it with the stuff to be re-shelved, you saw an employee, whose name-tag identified them as Carol, and walked over.

"Excuse me... I'm having a bit of a sensitivity problem and all the clothes I've tried just aren't doing it. Do you have any recommendations?" you asked.

"Uh, I think that's probably the best you'll get in Men's... Unless..." Carol started. "Nah."

"Unless what?" you asked.

The chafing felt like it was getting worse by the minute, it probably warranted a doctor's appointment, but you needed new clothes in order to even function enough to make the appointment!

"Well, I know that uh... the clothing in the Ladies department tends to be much softer and easier on the skin. At least from personal experience." Carol said.

"At this point, I'll take it." you said. "Thanks."

You made your way to the women's department and began to browse around, nonchalantly, picking up a few things in your size, and quickly heading into the men's dressing room.

Thankfully, this new batch seemed to be working fine. A pair of sweatpants that were mostly masculine as they were gray, with only a pink logo emblazoned on the front of the thigh, easily covered up. A few more pairs of women's pants, only lacking pockets to distinguish them from men's, a few blouses of blues and greens, and some camisoles for undershirts finished off your choices, and you quickly checked out, rushing home to change into something more suitable, choosing a camisole, a powder blue blouse, and a pair of dress pants that felt far softer.

"Ahhhhhh...." you sighed as you wrapped yourself in a hug.

The discomfort was gone! How wonderful! And just in time, you had to head out to the show!
154322111111.title: Shopping before the next show

choices: You wake up at home in bed
You're on the dressing room couch
1543221111111.content:
Arriving at the venue, you noted how big the crowd seemed. You wondered how Alfred would cheat these people out of their money this time. You noticed a few weird stares from the security guys, but you didn't think much of it. Clothes are clothes, and these were comfortable. Heading into the dressing room, Alfred was buttoning up his shirt and combing his hair.

"Ah, Alex. Glad you made it. Ready to learn my secrets?" Alfred asked.

"Of course. Let's get this over with." you replied.

"In due time, in due time. By the way, I like your new clothes. Far more professional and befitting." Alfred remarked.

"Thanks!" you beamed.

You didn't know why, but for some reason, the compliment made you feel really happy. You glanced at the closet, with the garment bag still inside.

"Nikki still hasn't picked it up?" you asked.

"How did you know..." Alfred wondered.

"I do my research." you smiled.

"I'm sure you do, purple polka-dotted orangutan." Alfred said.

Like the last show, your eyes suddenly felt heavy, and before you knew it...
1543221111111.title: At the show

choices: You ask Sarah if you can tag along
You decide to take care of it on your own
15432211111111.content:
The next thing you knew, you were staring up at the ceiling, but not the ceiling in the dressing room. It was the ceiling in your apartment. You jumped, realizing you didn't remember coming home after the show.

"How did I..." you started, but were interrupted when a loud knock came from the door.

You quickly leaped out of bed, and rushed to the door, checking the peephole. It was Sarah, which was strange, you hadn't remembered inviting her over... had you? You opened the door.

"Sarah! What an unexpected surprise?" you asked, as you let Sarah in.

"Alex, sorry for dropping by unannounced, but I wanted to check on you after yesterday..." Sarah started, then noticed what you were wearing, a pair of the sweatpants you'd bought yesterday and one of the camisoles. "What are you wearing?"

"I took your advice!" you exclaimed. "This fixed the problem right up. No more chafing!"

"That's not quite... You know what? It doesn't matter. You said you felt better?" Sarah asked.

"Yep!" you replied. "All thanks to you!"

"I can't take all the credit. Say, how much did you get paid?" Sarah asked.

"Oh!" you exclaimed. "I almost forgot..."

You scanned the room, spotting an unfamiliar envelope on a table. You rushed over and picked it up, finding it opened, and pulled out the check, made out to you, for $200.

"Nice!" Sarah remarked. "All that for just a few hours?"

"I guess so." you said.

"I'm glad you're okay." Sarah said. "After the other day, I was worried. Be careful Alfred doesn't mess with your head."

"Will you stop worrying? It ain't real! And I'm this close to figuring him out." you said.

"If you say so..." Sarah said, reaching into her jacket pocket and pulled out her phone, checking the lock screen. "Oh, I gotta run. Jane and I are getting manicures."

Suddenly, you felt a little self-conscious of your nails. You remembered how good it felt when Alfred complimented the professionalism of your clothes, but looking at your nails, they were ragged and dirty. Somehow, this never mattered before, but it mattered now. You felt the urge to do something about making them look better.

That's why...
15432211111111.title: You wake up at home in bed

154322111111111.content:
As Sarah walked towards the door, you quickly spoke up.

"Uh... Do you mind if I come with?" you asked.

Sarah stopped dead in her tracks and turned around with a puzzled look on her face.

"You're interested in getting a manicure?" Sarah asked.

"Yeah... well... it's just that... I don't know, something about my nails are bothering me. You probably think it's weird." you replied. "Forget it."

"No! No, it's not weird, it's just... I didn't think you took that much pride in your appearance." Sarah insisted. "Lots of guys do it, mainly high-society guys, but it's starting to become mainstream. We'd be glad to have you along."

"You're not just saying that to make me feel better?" you asked.

"Of course not!" Sarah replied. "As long as no one hypnotized you to get one."

"Don't even joke!" you grimaced. "I'll get my coat."

A half-hour later, after getting into another blouse and a pair of new jeans, you were sitting in a salon chair in between Jane and Sarah, getting your fingernails buffed by a very nice nail-tech named Erin who didn't even blink when you walked into the salon. Sure, the clientele was all women, but you didn't feel out of place in the slightest. In fact, you felt welcomed. Nobody commented, even when you declined their offer to trim your nails down. You liked them a bit long, you found.

"I wish I could get my boyfriend to let me do this to him. His are horrid." Erin joked.

"You just have to make a convincing argument for hygiene." you replied.

"Clear polish, I'd guess?" she asked.

"You guessed right!" you smiled.

You stopped yourself from going, "Although..." After all, there was always next time.

"Oh! I nearly forgot! We're doing a special today, pedicures are half-off with a manicure." Erin said, addressing all three of you.

Jane checked her watch and turned back to Erin.

"We've got time. I know Sarah and I are in." Jane said, turning to you.

You thought about it for a moment, it's not like anyone would ever see it, and you'd probably do clear polish too...

"Why not?" you accepted.

Once your nails were dry, you took off your shoes and socks and your feet went into a basin of warm water, which felt heavenly. Where had this been all these years?

After all was said, done, and polished, you and the girls headed off, meeting at the bar to hang with the rest of the gang. You realized that you hadn't ever really spent any time alone with Jane and Sarah outside of the others, and it was nice to have something special to do with them. It gave you the same warm feeling that Alfred's compliment had, actually. You'd have to do this more often.
154322111111111.title: You ask Sarah if you can tag along

choices: What did the text you get say?
You call your friends to find out what happened last night
15432212.content:
You’re on your way home, thinking about how you’re going to go about revealing this huckster.

Your phone buzzes in your pocket, you check it.

—-

You wake up in your room. Well, it FELT like waking up, but you weren’t in bed, you were sitting at the foot of it. There were receipts in your hand and a dress hanging up on the door of your closet. Some shiny, sparkly little number.

“What the-?” You ask yourself and then investigate the receipts in your hand.

“Where did these nails come from?” You ask gandering at the fake nails glued over your own. Your question was answered by the outermost receipt. You investigate the next receipt, $500 for that dress hanging on the closet.

“FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS?!” You yell, surely YOU couldn’t have bought it- there’s no way that you would have spent so much money on something you would never wear. You investigate the third receipt: it was for a hair place you had seen in town.

“No...” you assure yourself...before racing towards the mirror. Sure enough you had gotten hair extensions and a new do. You glance back down at the receipt, “TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS?!” Why on earth did you spend so much money to look like this?

“There has to be some explanation” you frantically mutter to yourself, “think...what happened last night? What’s the last thing you remember?”

You remember the show, the contract, your friends, and then the text message.
15432212.title: Before that

choices: You’re all-dressed up on the way to your first gig
154322121.content:
You scroll through your phone, trying to find the last thing you remember: a text notification. However, despite your searching, you can’t find any evidence of it. What the heck?

Frowning to yourself, you try your best to shake off the nervous feeling as you try to navigate changing into pajamas with the ridiculous nails you now have on. You’d tried to pry at one, but even if you could get a grip on it, they would probably be glued on with something too strong for you to pry off.

Your phone goes off and you go to check it, assuming one of your friends is texting you...

——

You must have zoned out, because you’re sitting on your bed still, and the text is once again gone.

“I must be really tired,” You think, not noticing your shaved legs as you change into some pajamas, “That’s why this is happening. I just need to sleep it off.”

Hours later, you wake up due to a text tone going off.

“Is that Josh? He always texts me at this hour,” You grumble, picking your phone up...

—-

You find yourself basically waking up in a car. What’s going on?
154322121.title: Mysteriously deleted text

1543221211.content:
Confused, you take in your surroundings. You’re in a car, headed...well, somewhere.

The last thing you remember is your phone, just like the other time, so the first thing you do is check that. Once again, however, you have no new texts. Though you did just get one from an unknown number.

“I don’t want to open this,” You think before pulling it open anyways.

Thankfully, nothing seems to happen this time. You don’t suddenly wake up somewhere else, so that’s a great start. Instead, you just get to read it.

“Are you on your way? Your first show is tonight and I want to make sure you know what to do beforehand.” You notice two other texts above this one.

One is from last night, sent by the sender. “It’s me, Henry, your new boss. c; You should be at the same auditorium as the show you attended by 11:00 am tomorrow. I want to go over somethings before the performance with you.”

What’s weirder is the response from you, sent only a few minutes after, that says, “Understood.” You don’t remember ever sending that.

That’s when you look down at yourself, and almost scream. The five hundred dollar dress you’d bought is now on your person. What the heck? How did this even fit? It was too tight on you, forcing your body to redistribute yourself in a different manner. If you didn’t know any better, you’d say you had cleavage. Furthermore, your legs were clean of any leg hair. So was your face, but that was usual. Your legs being hairless was not! And, for the cherry on top, you wearing some simple, black heels that Sarah had left at your house one time.

You’d never managed to find them when she asked for them back. How on earth had you found them now, and why were you wearing them? They were killing your feet!

“We’re here,” Your driver announces.
1543221211.title: You’re all-dressed up on the way to your firs...

15432212112.content:
“Listen...” you try to explain to the driver, “I don’t know how this all happened...how I ended up in your car right now to end up right here...but I need you to take me back where you picked me up...”

The driver responds....
15432212112.title: Before then

154322121122.content:
“I’m sorry miss, but I was only paid for the ride to this auditorium” the driver responds.

You look out the window and see the illuminated name of the hypnotist you were working for on the sign and cautiously begin to believe in his abilities.

“I can’t go anywhere near this place!” You plead, “I don’t want to be here!”

“Well,” the driver responds, “if you can pay me for the ride back I’ll take you back”

“Okay!” You hastily agree and then reach for you back pocket, obviously missing from your current attire. You then begin searching in the purse hanging from your arm. You feel embarrassed doing so- you’ve never had to rifle through a purse before.

Inside the purse you sorted through various cosmetics, and eventually coming to a feminine wallet.

“Okay! Here! Here! I found it!” You alert the driver.

You open up the wallet, but find it vacant of anything. “Why am I even carrying this thing?” You think to yourself- partially worried about what you’ll return to after the next time you “zone out” “why do I even HAVE this thing...?”

“Do you have the money or not?” The driver asks.

“Please! I know I’ve got the money back home, just take me back and I’ll be sure to pay you.”

“I’m sorry, ma’am, but I don’t work on credit” the driver sternly informs you.

“Please, don’t make me go in there” you beg.

“You don’t have to go in there- you just have to get out of my car”

Reluctantly you get out of the car, to...
154322121122.title: “No can do”

choices: “-I’m going to hypnotize you based off of the audiences’ requests.”
1543221211222.content:
With a groan, you find yourself instinctively walking inside. Seriously? Now it’s too late to turn back. You reluctantly make your way through the doors and backstage to the hypnotist’s office.

“There you are!” He says, looking you up and down. “Interesting look.” There’s a mischievous look in his eyes that you don’t like. “Glad to see you are dressing as our contract requires. And investing so much money into a job you claim to not want. How much was this dress?”

“Five hundred dollars,” You answer automatically, and then scowl at him.

For a moment, you wonder if you should confront him, but if you do, then wouldn’t you be admitting defeat? That would imply that you now believe hypnotism might be real, and you don’t. You just must be sick or something, that’s all. Sick and hallucinating and forgetting.

Though that still didn’t explain the purchase of the dress.

“What is this show going to require me to do?” You say through gritted teeth.

The hypnotist grins. “I’m so glad you asked! You see-“
1543221211222.title: Find yourself walking inside

choices: Yes, you subtly receive more hypnotic suggestions from the hypnotist
No, no hypnosis before the show
15432212112221.content:
You roll your eyes. “There’s no way you can pull something like that off, so alright.”

“While on stage performing,” He warns, “You cannot express your disbelief. Otherwise, a certain sub point of the contract you signed comes into play.”

The mischievous smirk makes you more than willing to play along while on stage, till you have real proof of his fraudulent actions.

Does he subtly hypnotize you again?
15432212112221.title: “-I’m going to hypnotize you based off of t...

choices: Opening your eyes and finding yourself on stage
15432212112222.content: Do you suddenly black out?
15432212112222.title: Something else

choices: Stay and figure out what he’s doing
154322121122221.content:
You come to feeling the hot spotlights hitting you while feeling lips on yours.

Your cognition slowly slips in before you realize what’s happening. You’re sharing a kiss with the hypnotist.

He finally pulls away while you’re shocked and speechless and says, “and that concludes the show! Everyone have a great night!”

The audience cheers and files out while the hypnotist guides you backstage.

Once out of the public eye the hypnotist asks, “Alright- where were we?” Standing intimately close to you.

“What the hell is going on?!” You yell.

“Oh! You’re awake” the hypnotist mutters, “perhaps next time...”

“Perhaps WHAT?!” You exclaim.

“Nothing. Never mind. Don’t worry about it. Go on off, I’ll see you for our performance tomorrow.”

“Like hell you will! I’m never doing this again you crazy pervert!”

“Of course, of course” he counters dismissively, “you need me to call you a cab? Or, if you like, I can give you a ride home.”
154322121122221.title: Opening your eyes and finding yourself on stage

1543221211222212.content:
“You’re crazier than I thought you were if you think I’m going anywhere NEAR a car with you”

“Quite right,” he says and then he pulls out his phone and orders a taxi to come round to the back of the auditorium.

The cab doesn’t take long and you run out and practically dive into the back seat.

“How are you doing tonight, darlin’?” The cabbie asks.

“Just drive!” You order.

And he does taking you to the destination he was given, which was
1543221211222212.title: Take the taxi

1543222.content: Do you wake up back at your apartment with no idea how you got there?
1543222.title: Something else

15432221.content: Is it actually your apartment, or do you just think it is?
15432221.title: Back home

15433.content:
Summer Camp Bummer: When you accidentally get on the wrong bus, and end up being sent to a girl's camp.

Fill-In Babysitter: When you are asked to babysit a neighbor's daughter, increasingly bizarre circumstances lead you to end the night dressed a girl.
15433.title: More choices

choices: A bus full of teenage girls on the highway
154331.content:
You are Leslie Daniels. It's a family name, you were named after your great grandfather. You're a boy, though with your long hair and thin body you had been mistaken for a girl a few times, though never on a scale of this nature. You're fifteen and heading for your last year of summer camp. Your parents dropped you off bright and early at the pickup location before they had to go to work and you dropped your bag with all the other boys' bags. You went up to one of the directors.

"Name?" the director, a woman, asked.

"Leslie Daniels." you said.

"Bus Two." she said, directing you to a bus.

You got on and went straight to the back of the bus and sat near the window. You waited, but as you were so early, no one was showing up, so you elected to take a nap. You fell asleep and woke up to...
154331.title: Summer Camp Bummer

1543311.content:
You groggily woke up and took stock of your surroundings, noticing that the bus didn't smell like sweat and cologne, it smelled more like... perfume? You brushed your hair out of your face and listened to the noises coming from around you. Pop music, chatter about clothes and boys and your eyes slowly widened.

"I'm on the wrong bus... but that lady...." you thought.

You were taken out of your thought by a tap on the shoulder. A girl, around your age, had moved from the seat across into yours.

"Hi, I'm Kendra." she said, extending her hand, which was well manicured and dainty, compared to yours.

"Leslie..." you squeaked. You had to get out of here.

"You must've been tired, you slept through almost the entire bus ride." she said.

You had to find a counselor and explain what happened. You went to stand up, but the bus stopped.

"Okay girls, we're here. Welcome to camp!" a cheery woman exclaimed from the front.

You sat back while everyone got off the bus. You got off last and approached the counselor.

"Excuse me." you said.

"What is it, sweetie?" she asked.

"Uh, this is a little awkward but... I'm at the wrong camp. I'm supposed to be at the boy's camp." you said.

"Name?" she asked.

"Leslie Daniels." you replied.

"Nope, we have you down here on our roster." she said.

"But I'm a boy." you said.

"Well, you're not dressed very girly but I wouldn't go that far." she said.

"No, you don't understand..." you said.

But she ignored you and walked over to they were unloading the bags. That was your chance. If you showed them your bag, they'd have to believe you. You waited as bags were claimed...
1543311.title: A bus full of teenage girls on the highway

15433111.content:
Eventually, there were no bags left. You sighed in defeat.

"Of course, the bag probably made it to the right camp." you said.

"Okay, Leslie Daniels, you're in Cabin 8 with... Kendra, Annie and Nora." the counselor, whose name you later found out was Carla, said.

"Please listen to me. I'm not a girl. I don't belong here. I'll prove it!" you said, getting ready to drop your pants to make you point.

Carla quickly grabbed your arm.

"Young lady! That is not appropriate! The roster said you had behavioral problems, but I didn't expect it to be this bad." she said. "Report to your cabin!"

You decided to give up and just listen to what she said. You had no cell phone, the camp had a strict no-technology rule, and you knew that she wasn't going to budge. You'd see if you could use a phone later to call your parents and explain the problem.
15433111.title: Your bag isn't there

154331111.content:
Carla led you to Cabin 8, where you walked in and were introduced to not only Kendra, from the bus, but two other girls, Annie, a short, black haired girl and Nora, a tall redhead, who was a head taller than you.

"Leslie! I was hoping you'd be in our cabin!" Kendra exclaimed. "Where's your bag?"

"It... got lost." you said, deciding to not bring in your cabin-mates on your true identity to make it easier to get out when you could convince the counselors.

"Oh no!" Annie shouted.

"That's alright, we can lend you stuff until it gets here." Kendra said.

"Well, at least you'll have your cabin shirt." Nora said, pointing to the remaining bunk, which had a baby blue t-shirt sitting on top of it. One that you noticed the three girls were wearing as well, in contrast to your band t-shirt and jean shorts.

"Great..." you muttered.

"Come on, try it on!" Kendra said.

"Oh, I don't really want to, right now." you said, not wanting to take your shirt off in front of them for fear of exposing your lack of breasts.

"There's nothing to be ashamed of." Annie said as she grabbed your shirt from behind and pulled it up over your head.

You immediately covered up your chest, expecting the girls to riot and go straight for Carla, but they just stood there.

"That's what you were afraid of? That you're flat-chested?" Nora asked.

"It's not a big deal, Leslie. Some people are just late bloomers, though you probably should have worn a bra." Kendra said.

"I..." you started.

"It's alright, you can borrow one of mine." Annie said, walking to her bad, and pulling out a pink bra. She handed it to you.

You looked over it for a minute, and sheepishly tried to put it on the best you could, managing to succeed after a few moments. You then put on the shirt, which proudly emblazoned the words "Cabin 8" across your chest. Could this day get any worse?

"Campers!" you heard shouted from outside. "Report to the signpost for orientation!"

"Come on!" Kendra shouted as she grabbed your arm and dragged you out of the cabin.
154331111.title: Meeting your cabin-mates

1543311111.content:
You sat in a circle, surrounded by the girls of the other cabins as Carla began to explain the rules of the camp.

"First and foremost, no technology. But of course you are allowed to call your parents for any reason if you need to. But you can't monopolize the phone, we only have the one." Carla started.

You sat there as she explained everything, though you were hoping that you'd be gone before you'd have to heed any of those rules.

"We're going to have a lot of fun this year, girls. Lots of activities, and hopefully forging lifetime friendships." Carla finished. "You can go back to your cabins. Dinner is at 6 tonight, so make sure you don't miss it."

You ran up to Carla as she started walking away.

"Excuse me, I need to use the phone." you said.

"For what?" she asked.

"To call my parents... my bag went missing." you replied, hoping she'd be more inclined to let you use it out of pity.

"Alright. It's in the main office." she pointed towards a large cabin-like building.

You ran inside and asked the person inside to use the phone. You dialed up your home number, and got an answering machine. Then you tried cell phones, and no one picked up, not even the few neighbors that you knew. Eventually, another girl walked in to use the phone.

"Can I use it now?" she asked.

"Hold on, I'm still using it!" you replied.

"You've been using it for twenty minutes, it's my turn!" she said.

The woman inside the main office turned from her work to you and the girl.

"Young lady, you have been monopolizing it. Let the other girl use it." she said. "You can try again tomorrow."

You wanted to snap back, but you also didn't want to get in trouble, because that would make it less likely that you'd be able to convince anyone of your identity, if they thought you were just a badly behaved girl.

"...Fine." you said, handing the receiver to the girl and you walked back outside.

As you did, a group of girls rushed past you and you were knocked bottom first into a dirty puddle. You stood up, and realized your shorts were ruined. You rushed back to Cabin 8 to try to wash them in the bathroom sink, along with your underwear. The girls of Cabin 8 had seen you run into the bathroom and a knock came on the door.

"Leslie?" it was Annie.

"I'm busy!" you shouted.

"We saw your shorts... Kendra has a pair you can borrow. And I have a pair of underwear if you need." Annie said.

You realized that even if you washed them, you'd have to wait for them to dry, and you reluctantly walked to the door.

"I'll take both." you sighed. You wrapped a towel around your waist and opened the door, getting a pair of pink panties, to match the bra, and a pair of denim short shorts to replace your shorts.

You changed into them and emerged from the bathroom, your sneakers and socks being the only vestige of male clothing you had left.
1543311111.title: Orientation

15433111111.content:
You never were a hairy person, so with the girl's shorts, and your natural lack of hair on your legs and face, you really did look like just another girl at the camp. You grimaced as you lay on your bunk, realizing that this was going to be a long day. A few hours later, Kendra, Nora and Annie announced that they were heading to dinner. Your stomach rumbled and you realized that you hadn't eaten all day, and reluctantly joined them. You went to the mess hall, which, for a summer camp was surprisingly nice. You got your food and sat at a table, populated with a few other cabins of girls and quietly started eating.

"What are you looking forward to the most, Kendra?" Nora asked.

"Swimming, mostly. It's so great to just go out into the lake and swim, it's always been my favorite part of camp." Kendra replied. "What about you?"

"Nature hikes and bird watching." Nora said. "Annie?"

"Ugh, I hate all this outdoorsy stuff. I'll stick to just the arts and crafts stuff. My mom always likes it when I make her picture frames anyway." Annie said.

"What about you, Leslie?" Kendra asked.

"Oh, uh... I don't know, a little of everything I guess." you muttered as you kept eating, eager to remain outside of the conversation.

"You are totally going on a hike with me." Nora said. "You'll love it."

"I guess we'll see..." you weakly smiled and continued eating.

Carla walked in and got everyone's attention.

"Alright, campers! The activity schedule has been posted, you'll get to see what we're doing every day for the next month, plus any extra activities like the camp musical." Carla said.

"Musical? Ugh." you thought to yourself.

You are getting out of here before they even hold auditions.

Dinner ends and...
15433111111.title: Later, at Dinner

154331111111.content:
The other girls of Cabin 8 went back to the cabin and you approached Carla again, hoping to explain your situation better than you did earlier.

"Carla?" you asked.

"Yes, Leslie?" she replied, looking up from her clipboard.

"Uh, I know I said this before, but there's been some sort of mix up. I'm not a girl, I'm a boy. Have been since I was born. If you could just call the boy's camp, they're probably looking for me." you said. "I don't want to cause trouble but, I just don't belong here."

"Leslie, you have to stop with this. I know you don't want to be here, but I'd say make the best of it, because you're here until camp ends." Carla said.

"No, you really don't get it. This is a mix-up, there must be two Leslie Daniels or something, but I'm not a girl. For all we know, she's at the boy's camp in my place!" you said.

"I'm not going to say it again, get used to being here, and no amount of trying to convince me that you're a boy is going to work." Carla sternly said.

"This woman really is dense, isn't she?" you thought to yourself.

You'd be better off trying to convince your cabin-mates, but you don't want to open that can of worms, since they might not be as forgiving as you wish they'd be. You went back to the cabin, and found the girls gathered around, talking.

"Hey, Leslie! Come on, join us, we're talking about our favorite bands," Annie said.

"Maybe later." you said, climbing into your bunk.

"Oh, and I have a spare pair of PJ's you can borrow." Nora said. "I left it in your part of the dresser."

"Thanks." you sighed.
154331111111.title: Later that night

1543311111111.content:
You lay down under the covers until the other girls fell asleep. You quietly got out of bed and walked over to the dresser. You opened it and pulled out a pink nightgown.

"Ugh." you said. "This just keeps getting worse."

You stripped down to just the bra and panties and changed into the nightgown. You climbed back into bed and tried to fall asleep. You couldn't get comfortable in the nightgown, since the material was very different than you had worn before. You decided to go into the bathroom and looked at yourself in the mirror. You hated it, but you looked like a girl. You slowly left the bathroom, and climbed back into bed.

The next morning...
1543311111111.title: Time for bed?

15433111111111.content:
It takes a while to fall asleep and you awake to the bustle of the three girls getting dressed and ready for breakfast. You sat up and Annie excitedly pulled something towards your bed.

"Leslie! Your bag showed up this morning!" Annie exclaimed.

"My bag?" you asked, you were excited for a moment, before Annie plopped a suitcase on your bed, one that was decidedly, not your own. Must be the other Leslie's. "Oh... this isn't mine."

"Of course it is!" Kendra said. "It's got your name on it!"

You looked and of course it did.

"I think she was just looking forward to borrowing one of your skirts." Nora said.

You sighed and opened the bag, prepared for the worst, and it was. It was the girliest set of clothes, cosmetics and accessories that you had ever seen. Blouses, skirts, shorts, a few dresses, bras and panties, sandals, hair products, makeup and jewelry.

"Must feel great to have your stuff back, huh?" Annie asked.

"Yeah... great." you sighed.

"Anyway, we're heading to breakfast, better get dressed if you wanna catch up!" Kendra said as they left the cabin.
15433111111111.title: "Your" bag turns up

choices: Breakfast with the girls of Cabin 8
154331111111111.content:
You looked in the bag and found that the real Leslie must also be flat chested, since her bras had some padding in them, likely to make up for it. You groaned and put on a fresh bra and panties. You pulled your hair back with a hair tie and found another pair of shorts, though this time they were pink, and you used the same "Cabin 8" shirt. You slid on your own socks and shoes, your last vestige of masculinity and looked in the mirror. Looking in the mirror, you looked the part of a camper.

"I hope wherever the other Leslie is, she's having as much fun as I'm not." you sighed and walked to the mess hall for breakfast.
154331111111111.title: Getting dressed

1543311111111111.content:
You grabbed your food and sat down with Nora, Annie and Kendra, who were excitedly talking about the day's activities. They immediately tried to bring you into the conversation.

"Looks like the first craft activity is bracelets." Annie said. "Wanna join me, Leslie?"

"Maybe some other time." you idly said.

"Oh come on, I know you were probably dumped here by your parents and you'd rather be somewhere else, but you've gotta get into the spirit! You've spent the entire first day moping!" Kendra exclaimed. "You're doing an activity with us today. It's up to you which one."

"I'm going bird-watching." Nora said. "Could always use a buddy!"

"Or you can come with me, they're putting together softball teams. If you don't wanna play, you can at least be one of the cheerleaders." Kendra said.

"Girls, listen I..." you started.

"We're not taking no for an answer. Pick an activity." Kendra snapped.

"Why do you care so much about what I'm doing?" you asked.

"Rule #2 of the camp: It is the duty of cabin-mates to ensure that every member of the cabin is involved with activities and enjoys themselves. And Rule #4 No Loners Allowed." Nora replied.

"I don't have a choice, do I?" you asked.

You really didn't want to do any of these dumb activities, but if Carla refuses to listen, no one at home will answer the phone, you have no choice.

The girls shook their heads negatively.

"Fine... Uh, I guess I'll do..."
1543311111111111.title: Breakfast with the girls of Cabin 8

15433111111111111.content:
You didn't want to play softball and wanted less to be a cheerleader. And bracelets sounded boring, so you figure at least bird-watching might be interesting.

"I guess I'll do bird-watching." you said.

"Awesome" Nora beamed. "It'll be so fun!"

You finished off your breakfast and walked back to the cabin with your "new friends", and they all but forced you to be involved with their conversations.

"Say, I hope you don't me asking, but I found it a little weird. You have all that makeup and hair stuff in your bag, and you haven't used any of it yet... any particular reason why?" Annie asked.

"I just... haven't felt like doing it, that's all." you replied.

"I think that was her way of asking to borrow something." Kendra giggled.

Nora and Annie joined in with the chuckling.

"You can borrow whatever you girls want." you said. "Least I can do for letting me borrow your stuff when I didn't have my bag."

"Thanks, Leslie!" Annie exclaimed, hugging you.

Once you got back to the cabin...
15433111111111111.title: Bird-watching

154331111111111111.content:
Nora quickly grabbed a hiking backpack and started to fill it with items, a few water bottles, a compass and a pair of nice binoculars. She noticed you scrutinizing her packing.

"They give us binoculars, but they're never good enough for my liking, so I brought my own." Nora said.

"I see." you replied.

After she packed, you headed out to the center of camp, where Carla was pairing girls up for the hike. You walked up and when Carla asked for partners, Nora quickly grabbed your arm and raised it up.

"Very good, Leslie. Nice to see you're getting involved. The summer will only be bad if you let it be." Carla said, handing you a bird identification booklet.

You just smiled and nodded, determined to not deal with her again as you started out on the hike.

Against your better judgement, you actually started to have fun, checking birds off the list, using Nora's binoculars, if you weren't constantly being reminded that you were being forced to masquerade as a girl and no one would believe you when you told them you were a boy, it'd actually be an enjoyable experience.

A bird perched on a branch, and you tried to get a good vantage point to look at it. You ended up stumbling and falling into a patch of leaves, which turn out to be...
154331111111111111.title: Heading out with Nora

choices: Attempt to explain your gender to the nurse
1543311111111111111.content:
Nora quickly helped you up, and another girl identified what the leaves were, to your irritation. Poison ivy... Your body started to itch, but Carla assured you it was psychosomatic... the rash usually doesn't start until a few hours to a day later. You finished up the hike and ended up in the nurse's office, where you were given a bottle of calamine lotion that smelled repulsive.

You returned to Cabin 8 and slumped down on your bed. Annie and Kendra were already inside and noticed you put the bottle down on a nightstand.

"Got some poison ivy on ya, huh?" Annie asked.

"Yeah." you sighed.

"Does it itch yet?" Kendra asked.

"Not yet," you replied.

Kendra picked up the bottle, opened it and smelled it, making a disgusted face.

"Well, if it does, you can use this." Annie reached into a drawer and pulled out a pink bottle.

"What is it?" you asked, taking the bottle from her.

"Last year I fell into some poison oak and my parents sent that up with me this year cause the stuff they keep around here is nasty." Annie said. "This has like perfume and stuff in it, so it smells nice."

You popped the lid and smelled it. It was much better smelling than the stuff you were given.

"Thanks." you said.

A few hours later, it started to itch like crazy, but the sweet, flowery smelling lotion soothed it almost immediately. You weren't happy here, but you were glad that your bunkmates seemed to be nice girls. But you had to make some headway into getting out of here. What to do next... You could try calling home again... or maybe if the nurse gave you a full physical and saw that you weren't a girl, she'd help send you home...
1543311111111111111.title: Poison ivy

15433111111111111111.content:
You decided to head to the phone, you had a sinking suspicion that the nurse wouldn't listen, and the phone was your best bet for instant gratification. You went to the front office and asked to use the phone, which they allowed.

"But no hogging it today, Miss Daniels." the woman said.

"I won't." you said. One call was hopefully all you'd need.

You dialed in your home number and waited as it rang, before it was picked up.

"Hello?" your mother answered.

Thank god! You were saved!

"Mom! It's me, Les!" you exclaimed.

"Les! Great to hear from you, how's camp?" she asked.

"I'm at the wrong camp! There was a mistake with the bus and I'm at a girl's camp! I need you to come get me!" you replied.

What you heard back was muffled and static-y. The phone call was breaking up. Is that even possible with landlines?

"Mom! Wait! I'm not at the boy's camp! I'm at the girl's camp and I need you to come get me! I'll send you a letter tomorrow!"

The phone cut off and went back to a dial tone before screeching in your ear about how you should dial the number again or hang up.

"Another bust..." you muttered.

You heard the loudspeaker start to crackle outside.

"Attention campers! It's dinner time, so get your butts to the dining hall!" Carla exclaimed over the speaker.

Your stomach started to rumble. All that activity today left you with a healthy appetite. You pushed the feelings back, but you were actually sort of happy that you had a group to sit with as you walked towards the mess cabin.
15433111111111111111.title: Try to call home again

154331111111111111112.content:
Dinner went by without incident, and you were happy that the girls didn't seem to take any objection to your eating habits, so you were able to indulge yourself. At least camp food is universal. Most of the conversation revolved around the events of the day, and so you were reminded of the poison ivy incident a few times whenever a girl from the hike passed by to check on you, asking about the rash and itching. Thankfully, the lotion you got from Kendra was working wonders, and you didn't see any sign of a rash showing up as of yet.

Once dinner was over, you headed back to the cabin. With a few hours before lights out, the girls started their nightly rituals. Nora was reading a book, Annie was putting on a face mask and Kendra was inspecting her toenails. You noticed her staring at you as you unpacked "your" suitcase, putting everything away in the drawers.

"Am I blocking you?" you asked as you moved out of the way of the dresser.

"Oh no, I was just wondering if I could borrow that nail polish." Kendra pointed at a bottle of bright pink polish that you had left sitting on the dresser as you went through all the clothes. "It's such a pretty shade."

"Yeah, of course. I told you it was all up for grabs." you said as you handed her the bottle.

Kendra grabbed your hand before you could pull it away, and inspected it.

"Been a while since your last manicure, huh?" Kendra asked.

"I've been busy." you weakly smiled, hoping that this wasn't the end of your charade.

"Sit down." Kendra pulled you over to her bed.

"I should finish unpacking." you tried to pull away, but Kendra kept pulling.

Eventually, you gave up and sat down, cross-legged, on Kendra's bunk.

"Tsk, tsk." Kendra giggled. "Though I guess bird-watching will get your fingernails dirty."

Kendra pulled out a nail file and started to work on your nails as she started to make small-talk, mostly inquiring about your life outside of camp. Apart from a few embellishments, you tried your best not to lie, given that it would be hard to keep a story straight if you lied to everyone.

Once Kendra finished rounding your nails, she started to paint them with the pink polish.

The worst part was admitting to Kendra that you'd never kissed anyone. Boy, girl, you hadn't yet been so fortunate, and blushed furiously when you admitted it to Kendra.

"Oh, don't be ashamed. There's nothing wrong with saving yourself for the right guy. Or girl." Kendra said. "Or if you don't want to do it at all, but based on that blush, I think you do."

"I guess." you giggled.

You'd never admit it to anyone, but getting your nails painted was actually relaxing, and talking with Kendra took your mind off your predicament. So much so, that you didn't resist as harshly when she offered to do your toes as well.

Eventually, Annie and Nora joined in on the conversations, and they were giggling like schoolgirls, and you were giggling along with them. This experience stunk, but that didn't mean that you couldn't find enjoyment in small things. Once your nails were dry, it was lights out and for the first time since you got there, you slept soundly.
154331111111111111112.title: After dinner

1543311111111111111121.content:
Like the previous day, you awoke to your bunkmates doing their morning rituals and preparing for the day. You yawned and scratched your face, remembering that you had let Kendra paint your nails before bed.

Well, you could remove that once you got out of here, so it wasn't a big deal.

You hopped out of bed and grabbed your clothes, quickly getting in and out of the bathroom, changing out of your over-sized t-shirt and shorts, and into a fresh pair of denim shorts from the other Leslie's bag, along with a fresh bra and pair of panties. You pulled your Cabin 8 shirt back on and brushed your teeth, exiting the bathroom with barely enough time for Annie to quickly rush past you.

"What activity are you going to do today?" Kendra asked. "We're still doing softball if you're interested."

"And I think there's another hike today." Nora said.

"I think I'll pass on any more hikes." you said.

"Probably smart." Nora said.

You started looking for a pair of socks, but all the socks (the other Leslie's socks) that you had put into the drawers had vanished. And they weren't with the other girls' stuff either. Come to think of it, you couldn't find your sneakers anywhere either. The only footwear sitting out were a pair of sandals with a slight heel. Not your sneakers, not even a pair of other Leslie's sneakers. You started to furiously look around when you heard chuckling from the other side of the room.

Kendra was having trouble suppressing laughter.

"Kendra? Would you happen to know where my socks and sneakers went?" you asked.

"Me? Oh I..." Kendra burst out laughing. "Okay, okay, it was me. I just didn't want my handiwork to go to waste underneath your sneakers."

Kendra pointed to your toes.

"Oh... I guess that's okay." you said, pulling on the sandals. After all, you weren't intending on doing anything overly physical anyway.

As the girls and you started to head out for breakfast, you suddenly remembered your intended plan. The letter to Mom!

"Uh, would any of you happen to have paper and a pen?" you asked.

"What for? A love letter to your crush?" Annie asked in a sing-song voice.

"No, a letter to my mom." you replied. "Phones haven't been reliable lately."

"I've got something you can use. Even have a few envelopes too." Nora started to dig through her bag, handing you a sheet of pink paper, an envelope and a pen.

"Thanks. I'll catch up with you in a bit."

"Got it." Nora said as the three departed for the mess hall.

You got work writing furiously, explaining your predicament and all the salient details. You begged your mother to come rescue you and sealed the envelope up, writing your address on the front. You'd bring it to the main office later, but even then, you'd have to wait a few days for it to be delivered, so your main concern was food, and you quickly ran over to the mess hall for breakfast.
1543311111111111111121.title: The next morning

15433111111111111111211.content:
After a hearty breakfast, you joined the girls of Cabin 8 for the walk back to the cabin.

"So, given any thought to what you're gonna do today?" Annie asked.

"I don't think I'm up for physical activity, especially since I don't have any sneakers today." you jokingly glared at Kendra, who giggled in response. "So I think I'll do crafts."

"Yay! I was hoping you'd say that!" Annie squeezed you in another hug and kept her arm around you as you walked back to the cabin, with her telling you all the fun stuff you'd be doing.

Kendra and Nora just rolled their eyes as they followed along back to the cabin.

Back at the cabin, Nora and Kendra gathered up their things for their activities, while Annie went digging in her bag for something.

"I forgot to give these to you yesterday, but I made them during crafts." Annie handed something to each girl, and then to you.

A bracelet made out of thread and beads. Looking closer, you realized that the beads spelled out your name. And the others spelled out the other girls' names. As much as you wanted to get out, your heart couldn't help but be warmed by Annie's gift.

"Friendship bracelets!" Annie exclaimed. "That way, we'll be friends forever!"

Kendra and Nora thanked Annie and put their bracelets on. In order to not raise suspicion, and for no other reason, you also put your bracelet on. Your's was made of various pinks, and matched your nails quite nicely. That is, if you cared about such things.

"See you later!" Kendra said as she and Nora left the cabin to head to their activities.

"Let's go, Leslie!" Annie grabbed your arm and nearly dragged you all the way to the crafts area.

Today's activity was tie-dye, which you thought was pretty cool. You were all set to start when Annie offered you a pair of rubber gloves, to protect your nails, which you sheepishly accepted.

As you tie-dyed with Annie...
15433111111111111111211.title: After breakfast

154331111111111111112111.content:
The act of tie-dyeing wasn't all that hard, and you found yourself getting dragged into conversations with all the girls there regarding colors and the cuteness of each design. Everything was going well, and you were biding your time until a poorly timed turn caused you to collide with another girl and fall backwards onto the table that had everyone's dyed shirts and several open bottles of dye laying on it.

In an instant, you were covered in wet, sticky dye from the neck down, mostly on your arms and legs, which were the most exposed.

"Leslie!" Annie shouted as she rushed to help you up.

As she helped, several other girls tried to salvage the projects while asking you if you were okay.

"Yeah, yeah, I'm fine, just... crud!" you shook your arms and blue dye dripped off of your elbow.

Carla rushed over, and inspected the scene, and turned her attention to you.

"You're okay? No scrapes or anything?" Carla looked you over.

"No, just humiliation..." you muttered.

"Don't worry about it, Leslie. It's not the first time anyone's done that just go rinse off in the shower cabin." Carla pointed towards an area that you had been intending to avoid during your stay.

Unfortunately, you didn't have much of a choice given that if you didn't act fast, you'd be stained for weeks, and that would be much harder to get rid of than nail polish.

You quickly rushed to the showers, with Annie promising to grab you a change of clothes from Cabin 8 as you sprinted.

Getting to the showers, you noticed that your sandals had fortunately survived, and you rinsed the clothes out in the sink before you walked into the showers and stripped out of your underwear. You glanced around to make sure no girl was hanging around, as you didn't want scare another camper if they figured out your real gender. No sense in causing trouble before you got out.

You hung the bra and panties, also un-dyed, right outside the shower, and without thinking, started to wash yourself with soap you had found lying there, probably left by another camper. Knowing how helpful and friendly everyone was, you didn't think they'd mind.

As you rinsed off the dye, and the assorted dirt from the last few days, you found yourself feeling serene and relaxed. You just had to wait a few more days and your mom would clear this whole mess up. Just a few days...

Unfortunately, you were so lost in thought that you didn't hear Annie calling your name as she walked into the cabin. Nor did you realize until she pulled the shower curtain open and looked inside.

"Leslie! I brought you a new shirt and!" Annie stopped in her tracks as you turned around, quickly covering up your crotch, but it was too late.

"I..." you started.

Your mind started racing. What was gonna happen now? She'd tell Carla, definitely, then the other girls. Could you be arrested for this? You hadn't really thought through this far when you debated going to the nurse for a physical. You didn't ask to be here, but you didn't think that anyone would buy that. And you didn't know why, but what worried you the most wasn't legal ramifications, but the fact that now, Kendra, Nora and Annie were going to hate you. Why did they have to be so nice?

Annie dropped the clothes and stepped back. You quickly dried off with a towel, wrapped it around your waist, grabbed another towel to wrap around your chest and ran through the camp, blowing past several confused girls as they watched a fellow camper sprint directly to Cabin 8.

You quickly rushed into the bathroom in the cabin and locked the door. You sank down to the floor and started sobbing. You weren't usually this emotional, but given the last few days, this was a culmination of all your frustration and anger and fear coming out all at once. As you let your emotions out, there was a quiet knock at the door.

"Leslie?" the voice asked.

"Go away!" you shouted through your tears.

"Leslie, it's me," the voice started. "It's..."
154331111111111111112111.title: You spill something on yourself

1543311111111111111121111.content:
"It's Annie." Annie said, softly.

"Leave me alone!" you sobbed.

"Rule #4... No loners." you heard Annie sit down on the other side of the door. "I brought your clothes."

You sniffled and unlocked the door. Annie opened it a crack and passed through a bundle. Inside the bundle was another Cabin 8 shirt, that she'd likely gotten from Carla while you were showering, and a skirt, along with the underwear. You shut the door again and locked it while you changed back into dry clothes.

You didn't see much reason to keep up the charade with the bra, but you put it on anyway, along with the panties, skirt and t-shirt. You took a deep breath and opened the door, you'd have to face Annie eventually, and you didn't want this to happen with Kendra and Nora around.

Annie immediately embraced you in a hug. You weren't sure how to respond, you assumed that she'd much rather attack you for the deception.

"I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have acted like that, it was just a bit of a shock." Annie said.

"I..." you started to speak.

"In hindsight it makes so much sense, why you don't wear makeup, why you've been hesitant to be girly, you're still new at it." Annie continued.

She thinks that you're transgender? That's... probably better for her, rather than find out that you got sent here by mistake and have been forced to pretend to be a girl.

"You're not mad?" you sniffled again.

"Mad? Of course not! We're friends!" Annie exclaimed, which made you feel really good.

"Are you gonna tell?" you asked.

"Tell who? Carla? No, if she doesn't already know, I won't spill. Kendra and Nora? If it's all right, I'd like to tell them, that way we can all help you in case something like this happens again." Annie replied.

"You can tell them. But don't tell anyone else." you requested.

"Don't worry. Your secret's safe with me." Annie mimed locking her lips with a key. "Pinky promise."

Annie held out her pinky, and put your's up to it and linked them together.

"Come on, let's go finish tie-dyeing." Annie said, handing you your sandals.

You smiled and quickly put the sandals back on, walking with Annie back to the crafts area.
1543311111111111111121111.title: Annie

15433111111111111111211111.content:
When Kendra and Nora returned to the cabin after their activities, Annie sat them down and explained the situation, and naturally, they were nothing but supportive, apologizing for what they now perceived as insensitivity regarding your lack of femininity. You weren't offended, of course, because you were just a boy trapped in this feminine web, and desperate to escape it, but it at least provided some cover and might help you in the event that something... unbecoming happened.

Dinner was uneventful, but fun, since you had started to pick up on how to converse with the girls, even subconsciously picking up on their speech patterns and using your hands more when you talked.

"You're definitely playing softball tomorrow." Kendra told you as you walked back to the cabin after dinner.

"We'll see." you said.

"It's only fair, you've done Annie's and Nora's activities. Tomorrow's my day to hang with you." Kendra said.

"If you say so." you giggled. Involuntarily, but it did feel nice to be wanted.

At the boy's camp, that you had spent every summer since you were 8, you made a few friends, but nothing substantial, and rosters rotated out year after year, so you very rarely had any lifelong friends. Meanwhile, you could tell from just watching, that lifelong bonds were being forged here at the girl's camp. It was a different experience to be sure, and one that wasn't as bad as the first day had made it out to be. Sure, you weren't happy to be here, and you didn't like dressing as a girl, but at least you were clothed and fed, better than being in a harsh environment with no one around who cared about you.

"Leslie?" Nora broke you out of your thoughts. "Whatcha thinking about?"

"Probably her crush." Annie giggled.

"Was not!" you retorted. "I was thinking about... how much fun I've been having here."

You blushed, you didn't want to have admitted that to yourself, let alone out loud.

"Aww, that's sweet." Kendra hugged you quickly, before she hopped onto her bed.

The nightly rituals started once again, and Annie talked you into a facial, despite your objections. Skin-care is a gender neutral activity anyway, right? After washing it off, because of the excitement of the day, you again drifted off into sleep easily.
15433111111111111111211111.title: Later

154331111111111111112111111.content:
You suddenly found yourself back on the bus... except this one was full of boys! This was the right bus! Had the last few days just been a really bad dream? You looked down at your clothes, they were the clothes that you had arrived with! And your fingernails were dirty and bare, just as they had been before Kendra painted them! Finally!

The bus quickly arrived at camp, and you were assigned to a cabin, the correct cabin, and you excitedly started to unpack your bag alongside your three cabin-mates. You could finally put that unpleasant girly stuff behind you. Though you felt a small pang of sadness that Kendra, Nora and Annie weren't real. They were good friends.

As you opened your bag, your heart sank. Inside weren't your clothes... it was the other Leslie's, the clothes from the girl's camp.

"See, I thought Leslie was a girl's name." one of your cabin-mates chuckled.

"Are you sure you didn't get on the wrong bus?" another one laughed. "Wait 'til we tell the whole camp!"

You started furiously blushing and tried to explain, but no voice came out of your mouth. You wanted to explain that it wasn't your bag, that it was a mistake! You were on the verge of tears when:

"Hey! Stop laughing!" Kendra suddenly appeared in the cabin and put her arm around you. "You okay, Les?"

Seeing Kendra made you feel a lot better, and while you still couldn't speak, you were able to confidently stand up.

You nodded and smiled, hugging Kendra and suddenly:

You woke up in a cold sweat! You started panting as you readjusted to your surroundings, this was Cabin 8, and you were again dressed in an oversized t-shirt and girl's shorts. You had never escaped... what the hell was that dream supposed to mean?
154331111111111111112111111.title: During the night

choices: Kendra makes you be a cheerleader
1543311111111111111121111111.content:
After the dream, you fell back into a more peaceful sleep until you were awoken by the girls. Annie and Nora had gotten an early start and left for breakfast right after you woke up. As you got dressed, you glanced at your toes and tapped Kendra on the shoulder.

"I can't really play softball in sandals, so..." you started.

"Oh right!" Kendra giggled and went over to her suitcase, pulling out a plastic bag containing all of "your" socks, (in actuality they were the other Leslie's) and a pair of pink trainers.

"What about my other shoes?" you asked.

"What other shoes?" Kendra replied.

"The ones I showed up with, and the socks they came with." you said.

"Oh... those were dirty and I didn't want them in my bag so..." Kendra glanced around the room, before rushing out of the cabin, walking back in sheepishly about a second later.

"Where are they?" you demanded.

"I left them at the bottom of the laundry hamper." Kendra admitted. "And it's laundry day. They won't just toss them in, but you probably won't get them back for a few days. I'm really sorry."

You wanted to explode at her, stealing your last vestiges of your masculinity, and then losing them, but... you knew she didn't mean it maliciously. It's not like anyone here was deliberately trying to trap you in a feminine web... it just sort of worked out that way because there were only girls here.

"It's okay." you said. "Just don't do it again or I'll have to go hiking barefoot."

Kendra smiled and you followed her to the mess hall.

After another uneventful breakfast, you followed Kendra out to the softball field.

"Okay," Carla said as she checked her clipboard. "Today's team Captains are... Kendra and Lauren."

You got a sudden sinking feeling that you knew why Kendra had been so insistent that you join her today. The teams were chosen, and Kendra picked you immediately. You were a bit nervous, you were never the most athletic boy, and could barely play baseball, but you were worried about the prospect of being a cheerleader.

"Well, looks like we've got a few more girls than we've had in the past few days on both sides. Too many to field at the same time, so you can all go up to bat, but when you're fielding, a few of you will have to sit out." Carla said. "Or cheer on the sidelines. I think we've got some pom poms in the storage shed, I'll go check."

"Okay, as Captain, I get to pick who fields." Kendra said as she addressed the team. "Leslie..."

Kendra pointed at you and opened her mouth. Honestly, either outcome made you nervous.

"You're going to..." Kendra started.
1543311111111111111121111111.title: The next morning

15433111111111111111211111111.content:
"You're gonna play outfield." Kendra assigned, eliciting some cheers from some of the other girls, likely the ones who got stuck playing outfield the previous days.

One of the other girls passed you a beat-up glove, which you slipped onto your hand. You were rather fortunate today, given that you found a pair of capris in Leslie's bag, so you didn't have to worry about a skirt or short shorts. You quickly pulled a hair tie from your pocket and pulled your hair back into a low ponytail, as Kendra assigned the other positions and you jogged to the outfield.

The one good thing about non-competitive sports, is that no one is really trying that hard, and so most of your responsibilities involved standing around, watching the in-field, or running after a grounder that got lobbed your way. Nothing major. That is, until the other team's captain, Lauren, got to bat in the fourth inning. As you'd find out later, she played competitively at home, and took the game seriously, so when Kendra pitched a fastball, Lauren popped it into the outfield, and straight towards you.

"Catch it, Leslie!" Kendra shouted as Lauren headed for first base.

You rushed underneath it, and tried to track its movements as it descended, but instead of landing in your glove like it was supposed to, it bounced out and smashed into your face, knocking you to the ground, and causing both teams to immediately rush the outfield.

"Oh my god!" someone shouted.

"Is she okay?" another girl screamed.

You were fine, but your face was throbbing with pain. You held your hand over your eye and pulled it off, at least there wasn't any blood.

Carla immediately broke up the circle around you.

"Give her some room!" Carla shouted, before she grabbed your other hand and pulled you up. "You okay?"

"Yeah, it just hurts." you said.

"Looks like it does." Carla said. "You're very accident prone these last few days."

"Bad luck, I guess." you said, before muttering under your breath. "In more ways than one."

"Kendra, take her to get some ice." Carla said.

"Got it. Steph, take my spot." Kendra grabbed you and started walking you back towards the nurse's office.

"Second time in a week. I don't usually see campers this much in the first week." the nurse joked as she checked your eye. "But nothing life threatening. You'll have a nasty shiner for a little while though."

"Got it." you held the ice pack to your eye as Kendra walked you back to Cabin 8.

You sighed as you stared into the mirror, with the help of that calamine lotion from Kendra, the poison oak wasn't bothering you anymore, and the dye washed off, but this... this was worse.

"This is gonna suck, staring at this for a week." you sighed.

"Maybe you don't have to." Kendra started digging through the other Leslie's suitcase, before finding something. "Ah ha!"

What does Kendra pull out?
15433111111111111111211111111.title: Kendra makes you play outfield

154331111111111111112111111111.content:
Kendra pulled out a makeup bag and smiled at you.

"Oh, I don't think that's necessary." you said.

"Come on, take a seat." Kendra insisted.

You sat down opposite Kendra on your bunk as she started to brush some makeup onto your face. You didn't really understand what she was doing, but she seemed to have it down to a science.

"And I'll have to use this on the rest of your face to even it out..." Kendra worked as if she was a classical artist working on her masterpiece. "And then your eye will need a little... And your lips..."
