1553322121111111111311121.content:
You were stunned by the question and your eyes nearly bugged out of your head. You hoped it didn't show.

"Ex...excuse me?" you asked into the microphone.

"Do you have a boyfriend?" the judge asked. She was an older woman, probably mid-late forties, wearing a very smart business suit.

"Uh... not at the moment..." you replied, scanning the audience for Cain, still staring at you.

"I ask because I have a son who you would love!" she laughed and the audience laughed with her. "I'd love to set you up together."

"I'm not... I'm not really looking right now, sorry." you said.

"That's all right." she laughed. "Can't blame a mom for trying!"

"If you could have any super power, what would it be?" the second judge asked.

"Um..." you thought for a moment. How do you answer this? It's a generic question, so I guess you can answer honestly, and just regender it.

"I think I'd like to fly. You know like, Superm...girl. Being able to fly, feel the wind rush in your hair, it would be really fun I think. And it would make life easier. Why give someone a lift when you can literally lift them and take them where they need to go?" you asked. "Plus you get to wear a fun costume!"

The judge nodded and smiled.

"Why do you think you should win this pageant, Elizabeth?" the third judge asked.

You hesitated for a moment, but after thinking, the words just poured out of your mouth,

"Well, I don't think I should win. I'm not the most qualified, and I've never done this before." you said. "The other girls are much more qualified and probably want the crown more than I ever will. Trust me, Sally and Jessica have probably been trying for years. I'd rather one of them win than me."

"Very astute and extremely modest, Elizabeth." the judge said. "That will be all."

You walked over to your place next to Sally and posed, hoping that all this will soon be over, once one of them is crowned. After Jessica finished, the pageant was nearly done and the host walked up to the microphone.

"We've seen a lot of smart young women today, but only one of them can take the crown and sash." the host said. "Now..."
1553322121111111111311121.title: "So, Elizabeth, do you have a boyfriend?"

choices: Try to slip out and hope Cain doesn't spot you
Too late! Cain makes his way to you eagerly
15533221211111111113111212.content:
"Jessica Karson!"

The girl next to you lets out a sigh of relief. Seems she wasn't as sure she was 'a shoe-in' as she was pretending.

You sigh in relief too. Winning would have been embarrassing...and maybe shattered what little was left of your masculine pride.

Jessica was led to the front where a crown and sash was out on her. She was beaming happily and you found yourself clapping for her as well along with the rest of the girls.

"And let's not forget our runner-ups!" one of the judges gestured for you and Sally to come up to the table as well.

You are given a bouquet with a small paper that read 1st runner up.

Wait. You came in second?!

"Ready, girls? Smile!"

Camera flashes filled your vision, as you stood nervously holding the roses. The crowd began to move, congratulating Jessica and the other girls began mingling. You stand awkwardly, unsure what to do.
15533221211111111113111212.title: The winner is announced; it's not you!

155332212111111111131112121.content:
You started to slowly back up towards the curtains, and when you got there, you rushed into the dressing room. You had to get out this dress... but on the other hand, the longer you hung around, the more likely that you'd be pulled into something else. You quickly looked around for the clothes you arrived in, but weren't able to find them.

"Damn." you muttered as you put the bouquet down onto a chair.

You heard voices approaching, the other girls coming backstage, more than likely. You had no choice, you had to get out.

You figured Cain might wait near where you tried escaping before, if he wanted to catch you, so you elected to go back through the bathroom, where this whole mess began. How poetic...

You walked through the bathroom, getting a look at yourself in the mirror. Even if you DID have your clothes, you'd still look like this, so it was probably easier to escape like this.

You got to the door and looked outside. The hallway was mostly empty, and Cain was nowhere to be seen. You started walking back to the main lobby, hoping that you can disappear into a crowd once you get there.

You keep looking back and forth to make sure that Cain isn't around, and in doing so, you accidentally slam into someone from behind. You fall back onto the ground. A hand reaches down towards you.

"Are you okay?" the owner of the hand asks as they lift you up, revealing...
155332212111111111131112121.title: Try to slip out and hope Cain doesn't spot you

1553322121111111111311121211.content:
You can't believe that you are looking up into his goofy grin again.

Why? Why was it that the harder you tried to avoid him, you were dragged back to him even harder like a the ball on a paddleball!

You quickly close your legs, trying to preserve your modesty as your face again flushed in embarrassment.

"I...I'm fine." you can't bear to make eye contact as he helps you back to your feet.

Cain Cain Cain Cain!

EVERYTHING today was his fault! It's his fault you were even here and it was his fault you were dressed head to toe like a girl and it was his fault that you-

Growl~~

You freeze up as your stomach makes its presence known. You realize you had been SO CONFIDENT this would be a flop that you hadn't eaten so you could feast on Cain's tab.

Cain rubs behind his head and smiles. "Oh...right. I guess it is my fault that you didn't get to eat anything before, huh?"

No, you kept me from escaping this...wait.

A thought dawned on you.

Cain had DRIVEN YOU HERE.

Even if you HAD gotten away, you didn't have your wallet of your keys. Luckily, you did keep one hidden near the door to your dorm room, but it wasn't like you had money for a bus back to the college dorms.

Your stomach rumbled again.

"Hey, so..." Cain said, trying to put on some charm, "To make it up to you, I could buy you some dinner." He checked his watch, "or lunch? It's two thirty, so...anyway! I came here with someone, but it looks like they bailed on me...How about I get you something to eat on me?"

You shift uncomfortably. On one hand, you felt like after EVERYTHING THAT HAPPENED TO YOU TODAY, you deserved to eat On his dime. On the other, you would basically be on a date with Cain.
1553322121111111111311121211.title: Cain

15533221211111111113111212111.content:
You didn't want to... but you were hungry, and the place that Cain suggested earlier to you... was significantly closer to your dorm, and you could probably walk from the restaurant, if things got hairy. You really regretted not changing out of the dress, but it was far too late now.

"You know what?" you asked. "I think I'll take you up on that offer, Ca-... er... I don't think I've caught your name."

"Cain!" Cain replied, before regaining his composure. "I mean... cool! I'll bring my car around."

"I'll be waiting..." you grinned as he walked away, before sighing and leaning against the wall.

As you waited by the front door of the venue, you saw many of the other contestants walking out with their families or boyfriends. Sally seemed disappointed, but had her composure, and Jessica was still being photographed on the way out. Who'd have thought that a beauty pageant would be that important. Though you were happy that everyone seemed to forget about you.

After a few minutes, you heard a horn honk, and saw Cain's car pull up to the curb. He stopped it and got out of the car.


"Madam, your chariot awaits..." he chuckled, opening the passenger side door and helping you in.

"Thank you, Cain." you said, smoothing out your dress as you sat.

"No problem, Elizabeth." Cain replied as he shut your door and ran around to the driver's side.

He started driving and the two of you sat in awkward silence for a few minutes until...

"So uh... I think you were totally robbed." Cain said.

"Huh?" you asked.

"You were really hot... I mean... good up there. You stumbled a bit at the beginning but you got better after that." Cain said. "You deserved to win."

"I really didn't." you replied. "Trust me."

"You can't be so hard on yourself. You're a pretty girl, and you made it to second place, I bet next time you'll take the grand prize!" Cain said.

"There won't be a next time..." you muttered.

"What?" Cain asked.

"Nothing." you said. "I don't think I'm cut out for pageantry."

"Coulda fooled me." Cain laughed.

You rolled your eyes and sat back in the seat as Cain pulled up to the restaurant.
15533221211111111113111212111.title: Agree to go eat

choices: Turn and talk with Cain a little more
155332212111111111131112121112.content:
Elizabeth seemed to be taking her loss pretty bad. That sexy confidence she had on the stage (especially sexy confidence when that bikini was what she was wearing), had vanished.

Now she sat, legs nervously together and she didn't seem like she wanted to look him in the eyes.

HE is the one who should be nervous, having such a hot girl in his car.

He found his eye drawn to her thigh, just were the dress ended. A thought flashed into his mind, his face buried in that thigh, kissing her leg up and down.

Cain's face immediately turn a bright red as he tried to hide his flustered look. Luckily, Elizabeth never looked away from the window back at him.

No...No...Well...only if she wanted.

He was going to be a gentleman to Elizabeth, show her how beautiful she was and maybe brighten up this disappointing day.

He took another look at the brown haired goddess in his seat and smiled.

God, what he would do to date her...
155332212111111111131112121112.title: Before that

choices: The waiter arrives to take your order
You excuse yourself to use the bathroom
1553322121111111111311121211121.content:
"And we're here." Cain said, stopping the car.

You were suddenly brought out of your thoughts as Cain took out the keys. Cain got out and walked around to your door, opening it, putting his hand out to help you out. You weren't initially going to take it, but you found it hard to push yourself out of the seat on your own. You made a small smile as you took his hand and you stepped out of the car.

"I don't know if you've ever been here, but this place is amazing!" Cain grinned as he shut your door and you followed him towards the door.

You knew this was his favorite place, and it was a good place, but you weren't sure you could live through a date with Cain.

Cain was able to get a table rather quickly and you were soon sitting across from Cain, staring at the menu intently. Cain was glancing at the menu, but it was obvious he cared about something else. Sitting there, you realized that you weren't even hungry, partly because the dress was hugging your body so tightly and partly because you were so nervous. But you were going to get a meal out of this regardless.


Cain idly looked at the menu, but his attention was mostly taken by Elizabeth. If she was nervous, Cain was doubly so. He wanted to start talking, but she kept occasionally looking away from the menu towards him and his mind went blank. He couldn't believe that his friend had ditched him! This would be so much easier if it was a double date... But he had to try his best.

"So..." Cain started. "Are you local or did you travel in for the pageant?"

"Uh..." Elizabeth started. "Local."

"Cool!" Cain said. Inwardly, he was excited because it means there's a better chance of a second date!


As you sat there...
1553322121111111111311121211121.title: Arriving at the restaurant

15533221211111111113111212111211.content:
As you sat there, the waiter, a serious looking man with a goatee walked up to the table. Cain put his menu down and smiled, as he started to order his meal, which he had been talking up to you for days, a perfectly seared steak with mashed potatoes and extra gravy.

As he did, you were fighting with your heels, and you managed to, despite the nails, pull them off your feet, which felt great to finally be out of, so great that you involuntarily stretched your legs out and your feet brushed against Cain's leg. He made a slightly startled gesture and looked at you, smiling, as you blushed profusely.

"And for you, madam?" the waiter asked.

"Um..." you started. "I think I'll have the same as him."

After hearing him describe it for days, you were actually looking forward to it, plus it was easier to order since you didn't have to speak all that much. You handed your menu to the waiter and he walked away. When he did, Cain turned back to you.

"Shall we continue that game of footsie?" he asked.

"Oh... I uh... I was just stretching my legs. You know, spending all day in those heels was murder." you said.

"I'm sure." Cain laughed. "I'd be glad to massage your foot a bit if you'd like."

"No!" you immediately said, jumping in your seat, louder than you intended. A few people turned around to look.

"All right." Cain said, putting his arms up in mock surrender. "If you change your mind though..."

You couldn't do this anymore. You needed to get away for at least a few minutes and get some time to think for yourself.

"I'll be right back... need to use the little girl's room." you said, excusing yourself and walking to the bathroom. You inwardly groaned as you walked into the women's room and took a long look in the mirror at yourself.

As you were focused on that, you heard the door open, but kept staring at yourself.

"Uh, excuse me, miss..." a voice starts. You turn around to find...
15533221211111111113111212111211.title: The waiter arrives to take your order

choices: It'll be worth it to go some place so awesome!
155332212111111111131112121112112.content:
"Miss Pemperton! Oh good... It was you who got into the car with that young man."

The woman from the pageant! Wait, had she figured you out? Or at least that you weren't the real Elizabeth?

"You forgot your prize." she reached out, holding the bouquet from before out to you. "It was quite the expensive prize, being second place and all. I am just glad I was able to catch up to you so you could get it."

You look the flowers and the sash around them over, confused, but slowly take them from her.

"Umm...expensive?" You say questioningly.

Surprise washed over the woman's face for a moment before she took another look at the flowers and realization replaced it.

"Elizabeth...the envelope in the flowers is the prize."

An envelope? Sure enough there was one tucked into the flowers.

Hey, maybe it was actually something cool, and after all that effort of accidentally almost winning a beauty pageant, this on top of a meal would almost make up for it all.

You couldn't believe it.

"Wow. Free admission for one day to Splash City!" you say, actually excited.

Splash City was the awesome, huge, indoor and out new water park not ten minutes from the dorm and the restaurant. You had been wanting to go for a while but the price of admission had been too step for you to afford at the time.

"There's tickets for two in there, Elizabeth. Maybe take your boyfriend in there..." the woman laughed, she felt much more relaxed and earnest now that the pageant was over, "that you lied about not having to the judges!" she seemed to be simply poking fun at you, not harboring ill will.

You still find yourself blushing. "He-he isn't my boyfriend! He is just my friend...my regular friend."

"Oh, of course. He must be a good one too, to treat you to nice food like here. Still, I did what I came here to do. Congratulations, Elizabeth! Enjoy!"

You found yourself honestly smiling as you waved goodbye to her, before turning back to the mirror.

Hey, maybe all this wasn't so bad. Even Cain being his...less than smooth self.

You smile and look at the prize again.


Wait.


Oh.

Oh no.

'Awarded to Elizabeth Pemperton for placing 2nd'

It was for ELIZABETH.

Fear hit your stomach as you realized there was only one way you could cash in your prize...

Go as Elizabeth.

You suddenly became VERY aware of the bikini under your dress.

You look down at the paper.
155332212111111111131112121112112.title: Someone from the pageant

choices: Stay out a little while longer
1553322121111111111311121211121121.content:
"I mean... I have the bikini... and it's more about the experience than what I'm wearing, right?" you thought to yourself. "Might as well make the most of it, because I have earned this."

You left the bathroom, happier than you were when you entered it and sat back down across from Cain.

"What took you so long? Are you okay?" Cain asked.

"Yeah, I uh... forgot something back at the pageant, so someone brought it to me." you said, holding up the envelope.

"Ooh! Is that your prize?" he asked.

"It is." you replied. "Two tickets to Splash City."

Cain's eyes widened in surprise and he started to choke on his drink.

"Splash City? Aw man, I've been wanting to go ever since they opened! Me and my friend wanted to go but, the admission was really steep!" Cain remarked. "Not that, you know, you have to take me or anything..."

"I was thinking about it," you started. "But I'll have to see how tonight goes..."

You were almost shocked at how easily you were able to slip into being Elizabeth, to string Cain along like this. Part of it is because you're friends, so you know exactly what would entice him, plus, it was fun to see him acting flustered, and after the day you've had, you deserve dinner AND a show.

Your food was delivered to your table and you and Cain both started to eat. As you ate, you wondered how you were going to pull off being Elizabeth Pemberton for at least another full day, since you had to make the most of that admission ticket. Hell, you didn't even know how you were going to handle wearing the bikini without the pareo, period.

Cain was still making eyes at you as you ate and started to consider your options.

"Food's good, eh?" he asked.

"Oh! Yeah, it's great!" you replied. "Best steak I've ever had!"

Once the meal was finished, and Cain paid, naturally, you started to get ready to leave.

"So, Elizabeth, where to next? Do you want to go home or stay out a while longer?" Cain asked.

You thought about it for a moment, before responding.

"I think I'd like to..."
1553322121111111111311121211121121.title: It'll be worth it to go some place so awesome!

choices: New pareo for the bikini (and Cain surprises you with a sundress)
15533221211111111113111212111211212.content:
Hmm...the pareo...you should definitely get one if you were going to try to pull this off.

And if you were going to buy any girl clothes, it should be while you "are" a girl.

"Well...I really liked the pareo I wore today in the pageant. I was hoping to get one like it to wear to Splash City."

"O-oh yeah?" Cain smiled nervously as the mental image of Elizabeth in her sexy swimwear made him blush. "I-I could take you to get one! Or just buy it for you to wear when we...er, you, go to Splash City!"

You can't help but laugh a bit at Cain.

"Oh, if you are offering to buy me clothes, your chances of going certainly do go up!" you tease him.

He obviously wanted to go and you did feel a little bad for him. Honestly, if it hadn't been you He asked, he almost certainly would have been rejected and glum all day.

You could play along and give his confidence a boost.

"Well, then shall we go?" you ask.

Cain eagerly leads you back to the car. It is kinda flattering, him waiting on you hand and foot, now that you've decided to make the most of this.

On the way to the mall, a thought crossed your mind to hold onto "Elizabeth" in case you wanted a free meal again, but You try to laugh the idea off.

Regardless, you realize that none of this means a thing if you don't have your own makeup, in order to dress yourself as Elizabeth when you go to the park.

As you get out of the car, you say to Cain, "Oh, and I'll need some waterproof makeup for Splash City so we'll need to stop somewhere for that too. And anybody who would do that for me..." you place a hand delicately on your forehead, "why I'd take him with me in a heartbeat!"

Your teasing did as you hoped, making Cain quickly perk up.

"O-ok, Elizabeth! What do you want to do first?"
15533221211111111113111212111211212.title: Stay out a little while longer

155332212111111111131112121112112121.content:
"Let's get the pareo first." you said, as you walked into the mall, Cain holding every door on the way in.

You walked into the clothing store and glanced around at the signage, you had never really needed to find the women's swimwear department before, so you needed to check the directory.

"It's this way." Cain pointed and started walking down one way through the store.

You followed him, and sure enough, he was right. You started browsing through the pareos, trying to find one similar enough to the one you wore today, since it did a very good job.

"Uh, I'll be right back. I wanna go look for something." Cain said.

"No problem." you said idly, as you looked through the racks.

After a few minutes, you found one, pink with hibiscus flowers printed on it, that covered up the necessary areas of your crotch.

"Perfect!" you beamed as you slung the pareo over your arm and started walking around, looking for Cain.

"Elizabeth!" Cain shouted.

You turned to see that Cain was walking back towards you, and he was carrying something in his hands. When you got closer, he held it out, a pink sundress with a flowing skirt that would probably go down to your thigh. Your shock must have registered with Cain because...

"I figured you might need something to wear over your bikini... or whatever other bathing suit you might wear tomorrow." Cain said.

"Oh... that was... very thoughtful of you." you said. You did need something other than this dress, though, and he was paying for it... "I love it!"

"Do you want to try it on?" Cain asked. "Make sure it fits?"

"Yeah, I guess I should..." you took the dress and walked to a nearby fitting room.

You were able to slip out of the dress you were in easier than your original dress, and you swapped it for the sundress. It fit perfectly... say what you want about Cain, he paid attention to sizes... you nearly gagged when you realized that he probably got it right because he was staring at you all day.

You stepped out of the fitting room and Cain was standing nearby, smiling when he saw you exit.

"How bout you do some of those moves you did up on stage?" he asked.

You laughed and shook your head, but decided to humor him. You started walking towards him, only to turn around, like you had done at the end of the catwalk, when you got near Cain.

But instead, you lost your footing, the store's floor being carpeted in that area, and one of your heels having gotten stuck. You almost fell to the ground, but Cain grabbed you in the nick of time, saving your head from smashing onto the ground.

You looked up into Cain's eyes as he lifted you back up and helped you regain your footing.

"Maybe you should get some lower shoes while we're here." Cain remarked.

"Maybe I should." you responded. It was a good idea, maybe get some flat sandals, since these heels have been murder all day.

"But the dress looks great." Cain said.

"Thanks." you replied, blushing.

You walked back into the fitting room to change back into your other dress and came back out carrying the sundress. Cain handed back the pareo and you started walking to another area of the store.

"Where to next?" Cain asked.

"Well, I was thinking that I should get..."
155332212111111111131112121112112121.title: New pareo for the bikini (and Cain surprises yo...

choices: You know, ice cream sounds nice
1553322121111111111311121211121121212.content:
"Some lower shoes would probably be good."

Cain followed you back to the shoe rack eagerly. He guided you to the bench and sat you down on it.

"My lady," he said taking a knee and holding out his hand to remove your shoe.

What a dork.

You blush and lift your foot. He carefully unbuckles the heel and pulls it off your foot. He turns it and looks at the size.

"Ok. One beautiful new pair of sandals for a beautiful girl, coming up!"

He turned to the rack and began searching.

"Ah perfect!" he said quickly pulling a pair of shoes from the options on the rack.

Cain returned and slid your other heel off before gently placing your feet in the new sandals. Simple brown sandals with pink accents and a hibiscus at each of the toe straps.

Upon standing, you could feel they still had a slight heel, but infinitely more manageable than the open toe heels you had been wearing.

"Well...what do you think?"

Now that the pieces were coming together...this plan might just work.

You smile. "They're great. And much more comfortable."

Cain nods approvingly. As he goes to pay, you put back on your high heels.

Omf. What a difference. Well, at least you were getting pretty used to them by now.

You walk over to Cain as he finished at the register, turning to hand you the bag.

"Ok, Elizabeth. Where now?"
1553322121111111111311121211121121212.title: New sandals

15533221211111111113111212111211212121.content:
"Let's go grab that waterproof makeup." you replied.

The walk to the store was actually nice, there's a certain... feeling that comes with carrying a bunch of shopping bags. It feels good. Maybe that's why girls shop so much, cause it's so fun to carry the bags. You kept walking until you got into the store.

Oof. This was going to be tough, because you didn't know anything about makeup, apart from that you needed it if you were going to spend another day as Elizabeth.

Again, it must have shown because a sales associate immediately rushed up to you and Cain.

"Excuse me, do you need any help?" she asked.

"Actually... yeah." you said. "I need some waterproof makeup, I'm going to a waterpark, but I'm not really sure what's right for me, color-wise."

"Considering how your makeup looks right now, I find that hard to believe." the sales associate laughed.

"She was in a beauty pageant, so someone else did it, right?" Cain asked.

"That's right." you blushed.

"A pageant? Did you win?" she asked.

"Second place." you said.

"Not bad... not bad at all." she said. "If you'll follow me over here, I think I know exactly what to set you up with."

You followed her and listened intently as she described what she said would work for your skin tone and how to use it. It honestly didn't seem that hard, and you could probably replicate what she taught you once, which was all you need.

Cain gladly purchased it for you, and the associate threw in some recommendations for "date night looks" that you didn't think you'd ever need. As you walked out of the store with your purchases, Cain turned to you.

"Is that everything?" Cain asked.

"I think so. I've got everything set for tomorrow, except someone to go with." you smiled.

Cain's face dropped. You wanted to keep watching, but you couldn't help yourself from breaking into laughter.

"Just kidding!" you laughed. "Of course it's you."

"Phew." Cain sighed. "Though..."

"Though what?" you asked.

Cain's gaze went over your head towards an ice cream store on the other side of the mall.

"We didn't get dessert at the restaurant... and what dinner would be complete without it?" he asked.

You could go for some ice cream... but on the other hand, you should really be getting back to the dorm so you can figure out what you'd be doing tomorrow... and how to replace the stuff you lost with your wallet at the pageant... decisions, decisions...

You decide to go with:
15533221211111111113111212111211212121.title: The makeup

choices: Cain drops you off and you sneak to your room
155332212111111111131112121112112121211.content:
If Cain was offering, why not?

Hopefully, whoever ended up finding your things would bring it to the school lost and found....hm....you need to come up for an excuse how you "misplaced" your pants.

Until then, ice cream sounded great.


Cain couldn't believe how well this had gone. Sure, his wallet was hurting, but not only had he been on a date with Elizabeth, complete with dinner and a night out shopping, SHE had asked him to go on a second date to the water park.

He honestly never expected the girl he asked to show any lasting interest, but the way Elizabeth smiled when he handed her the cookies and cream cone certainly shown she was having a good time.

Which meant he didn't have to buy dinner for a certain deserter.

Still, Cain couldn't care less as he sat opposite the girl on the pink dress. Another glance at her legs made his body turn warm and his cheeks blush.

...and tomorrow she would be in that bikini...

Cain smiled to himself.

Today had turned out great!

The last of the ice cream finished, you stand up, bending to lift your bags off the floor.

You turn to Cain with a smile. "That was delicious. Ready to go?"

Cain nods eagerly and the two of you make your way to the mall entrance.

Hmm...Cain should drop you off a little way off so you can sneak into your dorm without him finding out which it was.
155332212111111111131112121112112121211.title: Getting some ice cream

1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
"So where am I dropping you off?" Cain asked as you got back into his car after loading all your bags into the backseat.

"A block off from the college is fine." you said.

"Oh you go there? Maybe I'll see you around after tomorrow." Cain said.

"Oh, I doubt that." you thought to yourself. After tomorrow, Lizzie was gone.

"Maybe." you giggled as Cain kept driving.

Cain pulled up near the college, and you could see the dorms from the car. You got out of the car and Cain started handing you all of your bags. Once you had them all together, you turned to walk away, before turning back.

"Thank you, Cain. Today was... nice." you said.

And some of that was truthful, dinner wasn't bad and you'd rather be around someone you know while dressed like this than a stranger. God knows what would have happened if some other guy had been interested in you.

"See you tomorrow?" you asked.

"Uh... shouldn't I walk you in?" Cain asked.

"No!" you exclaimed. "I mean... I can handle myself."

"You sure?" Cain asked.

"Absolutely." you replied. "Goodnight, Cain."

With that, you walked down the block, turning around a few times to see Cain stand for a few minutes, then got back in his car and drive off. You sighed in relief and started heading to your dorm.

Now to find that key...
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: The ride to the dorms

choices: You get some unwanted attention anyway
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
Getting back in was, thankfully, rather uneventful. There was hardly anyone in the hall and the key was right where you had left it, hidden in a magnetic box tucked under the vending machine.

You had tossed all your bags down on the bed and let yourself fall into it.

After a few moments, you had taken off all the girly clothes and wig and then after washing all the makeup off with a shower (except the fake nails, which you couldn't get off so you put on a pair of gloves over them) you went to the lost and found.

Luckily, your things were there. You just hoped that the girl running it bought your story about getting a new pair of pants as a gift and forgetting to transfer your keys and wallet. She didn't ask why it was found in the girl's changing room at a beauty pageant, so you were probably in the clear.

As soon as you were done, you went back and straight to bed.

But now, as you faced the mirror wearing the bikini and wig, your stray hairs shaven back to a smooth shine, the cosmetics and jewelry you had wore the day before spread in front of you.

You had a beauty tutorial video pulled up and tried to follow the directions to transform back into Elizabeth.

It was a slow, long process, but after it was all over, Elizabeth Pemperton once again looked back at you in the mirror.

You stood up, pausing for a moment to admire your reflection, even striking a couple of girly poses.

"Perfect. I am going to have fun today, darn it!" you said with a confident tone, your red lips curled up in a smile.

You pull the sundress over your head and adjust the sandals until they are comfy. You hook the pareo over your arm and grab the tickets for Splash City before warily opening the door to the dorm.

He hurriedly worked the condom into place and opened the door. Liz was leaning against the dresser.

She was so hot... Her long hair down her back...The hot pink lingerie showing off her skin... There was no girl he had ever wanted more for his first time.

He slipped up behind her, cupping her waist from behind.

"All set, beautiful."

He kissed her again and again as he slowly pulled her to the bed. She was on his lap, her legs around him, squirming and quivering as he pulled their lips together.

"Elizabeth...you're...so perfect..." he whispered, reaching down to begin.

He pulled back the tip of the lingerie and...

He only felt her skin. Had he missed? Where was...maybe a bit further back...

There!

He felt himself enter her, tightness immediately taking hold. He started slowly. The condom was pre-lubed so as to make his inexperience not an issue for Elizabeth to deal with.

But if the sound she made was any indication, there was no issues for her. Cain smiled. She may have not won the pageant but, he wanted to show her that he thought she was the most beautiful girl he had ever seen.
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: Cain comes back before you get out

1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
Once everything was said and done, you were laying back on Cain's bed, panting as Cain disposed of the "physical evidence". You had pulled up his sheet to cover yourself as you tried to work through the intense feelings you felt.

A simple trip to a beauty pageant, led to you not only taking part in it, but also nearly winning it. Despite your lack of desire to win... it felt pretty good to get runner-up.

Your best friend, Cain, not only failed to recognize you all dolled up, but fell in love with you. Which repulsed you... at first. He was a good person, and treated Elizabeth very well.

You and Cain had made love. And you liked it. You liked Cain, you liked everything about that moment.

Cain returned from the bathroom and sat down next to you, taking your hand in his once again.

"Cain... that was... it was great." you said.

"I felt the same way." Cain replied.

"Thank you." you smiled and leaned your head onto his arm.

You could stay in this moment for the rest of your life if you had to. But there was something you had to admit.

"Cain, I..." you started.
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: You realize that you DO like being Elizabeth an...

1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
This was all too overwhelming. You broke your gaze with Cain and pushed out of the bed.

"Lizzie! What's wrong?" Cain asked.

But you ignored him. You rushed to the bathroom and grabbed your dress, and rushed back out, with Cain grabbing your hand to try and stop you from leaving.

"Didn't you enjoy that? What did I do?" Cain asked.

"It's not you... it's..." a sob broke from your lips and you slipped your sandals back on, rushing to the door of the room.

"Please don't follow me." you said, solemnly.

"Elizabeth..." Cain started, but you were already gone, slamming the door behind you.

You pulled your dress, Elizabeth's dress, over your head and made the run back to your dorm. Cain fortunately listened to you, so he didn't see you rush back to your own dorm. Course one could argue that it wasn't truly your own dorm anymore because you weren't quite yourself. You got some stares on the way, a girl doing the walk of shame, but you were able to slip into your dorm without anyone you knew seeing you.

You rushed inside and collapsed onto your bed, sobbing uncontrollably into your pillows. True to the packages, your makeup didn't run or smear onto the sheets, but that was little comfort. Your conflicting emotions were wreaking havoc on you, so much so that you barely heard your phone ringing.

You wiped the tears from your eyes and picked up your phone seeing a call from...
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: Something else

1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
You cleared your throat before you picked up the phone and tried to sound like you hadn't been crying.

"Hey, Cain!" you answered. "What's up?"

"Dude! What happened to you yesterday? You went to the bathroom and then you vanished!" Cain started.

"I uh... got sidetracked and decided to go home. How was the pageant?" you asked.

"Good uh... I met a girl. She was beautiful, I think she goes to school here, I dropped her off by the dorms last night." Cain replied.

"Did things go well?" you asked.

"I don't know. We hit it off last night, spent the day at Splash City together and made out, went back to my place, but after we finished she seemed fine, then she just got up and ran out." Cain said. "I have no idea why."

"Maybe it was too overwhelming for her." you suggested. "After all you just met yesterday. Just give her some space."

"That's the thing, I don't know where she lives, I don't have her number..." Cain sighed. "But she was perfect."

"I bet she knows how to find you when she's ready." you said.

"I hope you're right..." Cain said. "Mind if I come over and hang out?"

"Uh..." you looked around the room with the strewn feminine items, down at your still artificially lengthened nails, into a mirror at your made up face. "Can you give me like an hour? There's something that I have to do first."

"No prob. See ya soon." Cain said.

You hung up the phone and regained your composure. The first step was removing the wig, then the outfit you were wearing, the mix of lingerie and dress. Then you went over to the bag of makeup and found some makeup remover that you used to remove all the makeup on your face.

"Goodbye, Elizabeth." you said as you changed back into your regular clothes and tossed all of Elizabeth's stuff into a bag.

You shoved the bag into the back of a drawer and grabbed your gloves again, before making a quick trip out to a drugstore to get some nail polish remover. Once you got back, you were able to use the nail polish remover to loosen the nails, restoring your hands to their former, unmanicured form.

The nails went into the bag and it went back into the drawer, as you scraped all evidence of Elizabeth Pemberton from your dorm room before Cain showed up and you sat down and waited to see your friend.
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: Cain

choices: Cain reveals his true feelings about Elizabeth
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
You pulled on a pair of pants and a long sleeved shirt, to hide the evidence of your shaved body and waited for Cain to arrive. You were nervous and your stomach fluttered.

"Calm down, it's just Cain... my friend, and nothing else." you said. "He doesn't love me, he loves Elizabeth. I am not Elizabeth."

Cain showed up and walked into the dorm, he looked... lost, for lack of a better term. Which made it much easier to talk to him, because he wasn't really looking at you.

"Hey dude." you said.

"Hey." Cain said, dejectedly.

"Come on, you can't be sad about that girl all day, let's go... play a video game or something! Keep your mind off of it." you said.

"I guess." Cain replied.

You tossed a controller at him, which he lazily caught as you booted up your favorite fighting game. You picked characters and started to play, but it was clear that Cain's heart wasn't in it. You wiped the floor with him, every time, and he barely reacted. Eventually, he just lay back on your bed and sighed.

"It's almost like I can smell her, man!" Cain complained.

Shit! That was probably because you hadn't used any air freshener after getting rid of the evidence... maybe you could spin that.

"Probably you, dude. Tracking in her perfume or whatever from your dorm." you replied quickly, perhaps too quickly.

"Ugh!" Cain whined.

"Come one, she can't have been that great..." you rolled your eyes.

Cain grunts as he lays back.

You wanted him to react, to talk to you. And you knew how to push his buttons.

"Always falling for the braindead ones, eh?" you asked.

He just needed an emotional release, cause he sure as heck ain't getting closure.

"What was so awesome about her anyway?" you asked.

"You really wanna know?" Cain asked.

You nodded.

"Well..." Cain started.
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: Cain arrives

choices: You decide to bring Elizabeth back permanently
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.content:
"There was something about her. Like we only knew each other for a day but I feel like I've known her for years. And when we kissed... that's when I could tell. She's the one, man! The perfect, once-in-a-lifetime type of girl. It might have been my first time but... it's her. It's gotta be her." Cain said. "And I have no idea what set her off!"

"L-listen, dude. There are a lot of other girls out there, right? Maybe play the field a bit before deciding on this girl you barely know." you tried to persuade him.

"You don't understand! I love her! And I want to spend the rest of my life with her, I know that clearer than I've ever known anything in my life!" Cain exclaimed.

Your mind started to race with all your complicated feelings from earlier. Your certainty that you enjoyed the experience and liked Cain. No... you loved Cain. And if that was true, that meant that there was only one thing that you could do in this situation, and that was:
1553322121111111111311121211121121212111.title: Cain reveals his true feelings about Elizabeth

You grab your suitcase off the conveyor belt and hurry off to grab a taxi, throwing your suitcase in the trunk and directing the driver to your hotel.

when you arrive you realize your wallet's in your suitcase, luckily you keep some cash on hand just in case so you use that to pay the driver, then head into the lobby grabbing your suitcase as you go.

You give them your name, and since you'd paid ahead of time, they give you your room key and direct you to it.

You settle in, tossing your suitcase on the bed, ready to get changed out of your ratty shorts and wife-beater, comfy for travel but not really something you want to wear around town.

You decided to take a shower then get ready, since you had plans tonight.

Why are you on this trip?

choices: Wear the clothes in the suitcase
1553322211.content:
You're on this trip for business. The company that you work for sent you out on your first business trip across the country to meet with representatives from another branch of the company. You were excited to get this opportunity to prove yourself. The meeting was tomorrow, but you had the rest of today to check out the sights, and had a list of places you wanted to hit. You stepped out of the shower and walked over to the suitcase and opened it, preparing to grab a pair of your underwear, but instead you find something odd in your hands, a pair of pink panties.

"What the hell?" you asked as you started to frantically search through the suitcase.

It was full of clothes belonging to a girl, a teenage girl by the look of them. Your heart stopped.

"What am I going to do?" you asked yourself. "My wallet and ID was in there!"

You started to pace around the room, figuring out a game plan while in only a towel. You stop when you figure out what you have to do.
1553322211.title: Work

What are you meant to do? You have to go to a meeting with a client, but you don’t have any clothes, and your wallet is gone. However, if you lose this deal for the company, who knows what will happen?

In the end, you realize you only have one choice. You have to wear the clothes in the suitcase.

But what exactly do the clothes look like?

Ashley pulled away and watched as Sam tugged at the collar of his t shirt and smelled of Chrisitan Dior perfume. Her boyfriend now looked, sounded and actually smelled just like a normal teenage girl. This is good she thought.
"Oh honey, I'm sorry. Well as you move around playing volleyball, the smell will disappear." Ashley explained. "It looks like they're getting ready to start, why don't you go." Ashley saw Mr. Stevens once again approaching her.
"Are you feeling better? Cause you definitely look better." Sam asked as he backed away.
"I'm good now, go play. I smell the food being cooked so I'll grab you something in a little bit" replied Ashley
Sam turned one last time and said, "I love you" Just as Mr Stevens arrived at Ashley's table. So she replied very loudly, "I love you too sweety, now go play!"
They both watched as Sam ran towards the field for the volleyball net. His ponytail moved from side to side as he ran and the smell of his purfume was still lingering.
"She looks like she's having a blast!" Mr Stevens observed at what looked like a mother telling her daughter to go play with the other kids.
"Oh, she loves her sports, like I said, it's the tomboy in her."explained Ashley. "But don't get me wrong, she does clean up nicely and can really be a girly girl too." Ashley thought in her head, "why did I say that? Just stop talking about her....I mean him!"
"That's nice, it's really nice to finally see a part of you that we didn't know existed. You've been such a wonderful new hire and in just your first 2 months at the company you landed the "Dazzle Me" ad campain that we've been working on getting for almost a year now. I don't like to bring work up at a recreational function like this but I just didn't want to wait until Monday. We want you to head the "Dazzle Me" campaign. You're in charge, it's your baby." Explained Mr Stevens.
Ashley's eyes lit up. "Oh my gosh, Mr. Stevens. Thank you so much. That's amazing! I will not let you down."
"Please, call me Patrick." continued Mr Stevens. "We already told the Dazzle Me representitives that we put you in charge and they are very pleased with that decision. I don't know what you did, but Melissa Avery really likes you and can't wait to work with you." Mr Stevens continued to talk as Ashley noticed the volleyball game behind her boss.
She saw the teams consisted of mostly guys and only 2 girls, one of which was Sam. It seemed like the guys were playing fast and rough and a lot of spiking. Almost like they were trying to impress the "girls"
She watched as Sam was also shorter than the other guys. As Sam tried to put the volleyball over the net, one of the guys on the other team jumped up and slammed the ball back down at Sam making him fall to the ground.
One of Sam's teammates extended his hand and helped Sam off the ground, he put his hand to Sam's back and wiped off the grass that was on the back of his shirt. Sam high fived him and the other guy held onto his hand. Sam took that as he was tryiing to lock fists and shake but it looked really different from an outsiders point of view.
Mr Stevens finished up and said, "Is that ok? Cause I don't want to go forward with anything, if you're not completely positive about it and see the vision that me and the other supervisors see."
Ashley agreed and nodded. She hadn't listened to the whole conversation for fear that Sam had broken the disguise and maybe mentioned her as his girlfriend. But by the look of how the other guys were treating Sam, she believed that this plan was working.
She would be happy when this picnic was over and her and Sam could get out of there and never have to worry about this nightmare of a lie that she had created.
"I agree and I'm ready to take on this project the way you see fit." replied Ashley.
Mr Stevens smiled and said, "That is amazing! We will get the paperwork set up, and have a contract set up Monday, then we can go forward with everything. I'm so glad you're on board with everything. We're so excited to be able to work with you both. I'm going to put my apron on now and start grilling. See you in a bit Ashely." said Mr Stevens and then he walked away.
This was going to be amazing, Ashley thought. I'm in charge of the Dazzle Me ad.
I can't wait to tell Sam. She looked over as the game had somewhat ended. The guys were just sort of kicking the balll around while Sam and the other girl stood next to two other boys. The boys were tall and looked slightly older than Sam and the other girl. Sam was totally playing off the part of the girl without anyone even knowing, including himself. She watched as he blew a bubble with the bubble gum and one of the other guys pop it in his face. He was being flirted with.
She said quietly, "I better go save him."
She walked over to the group of kids and motioned to Sam as she got closer to come over to her.
Sam said, "gotta run" and ran towards Ashley.
When he got closer he said "I could really use a cigarette." as he removed her sunglasses and put them on top of his hair.
Ashley handed him her purse, as he unzipped it and took out his pack. He opened it, took out a cigarette and put it between his lips. He handed the purse back to Ashley.
"I forgot I didn't have a lighter as he removed the cigarette from his mouth, he looked at the tip and noticed a lipstick ring around it.
"Oh shit, you should have told me I had some of your lipstick on from that kiss earlier." he discovered.
Ashley quickly replied. "well, you ran off so fast, I didn't even notice.
Ashley handed him a tissue as he wiped all the lipstick from his lips.
"Let grab some food, I'm starving" Said Sam as he put the glasses back over his eyes and walked next to Ashley over to the bbq area.
They grabbed paper plates and walked over to the grills where the grillers were making hot dogs and hamburgers and chicken.
The woman grilling asked the two what they would like.
Ashley ordered for them, "I'll have a hot dog" The woman put a hot dog into a bun and then on Ashley's plate. "This one will have a 2 hot dogs, a cheese burger, and 2 chicken legs."
The woman's started to bulge out. "Wow, how do you keep such a slender figure?"
Sam just made a weird look as the woman loaded his plate up. They grabbed some other stuff, and some drinks and made their way back to the picnic table and began to eat.
Mr Stevens got over the speaker again and announced.
1553322221221.title: Sam left to play volleyball

choices: Pete putting his arm around Sam
15533222212212.content:
"After we eat, there's going to be a 3 legged race so everyone grab a partner."
After awhile Sam and Ashley were finished eating. Sam didn't finish everything on his plate, but he did make a good dent.
"Guess what honey?" started Ashley.
Sam looked at her waiting for the answer.
"I got put in charge of the Dazzle Me account. I get to work with the company and come up with thier whole advertising campaign." She explained.
Sam's eyes widened. "That's great Ash! I knew you could do it. You really worked at getting the account for the company so it was only fair to put you in charge." He leaned over and kissed Ashley.
Ashley pecked his lips and looked around to make sure no one saw that. She continued talking to not make Sam suspicious as to why she kissed him so quickly. "Mr Stevens says he's lining up a contract on Monday that I'll sign and go over some other stuff, and then I'll be in charge, thsi is definitely going to lead to bigger things."
"I have no doubts, I'm really excited for you babe, we will have to celebrate tonight...when we get home. Kind of finish what we started from the shower this morning." Sam started raising his eyebrows up and down.
Ashley smiled.
Sam stood up and grabbed Ashley's purse again and pulled out a cigarette. He also grabbed her car keys. "I'm going to use the car lighter, I really need a cigarette,babe." He started to walked away.
She quickly grabbed two more pieces of gum and called to Sam.
As he turned around, she threw it his way again and held her nose. "From the onions on the burger."
Sam smiled as he opened the gum and put it in his mouth.
Ashley started cleaning up the mess on their picnic table and walking to a nearby trash can when again she met Mr. Stevens.
"Hello Ashley." he said.
"Hello Patrick." She said as she tossed the trash away.
"We're just getting started with some relays over here." He explained.
"Oh I see that, it does look like fun." she replied.
He smiled. "Seeing as we are the same height and all, I was wondering if you would be my partner for the 3 legged race?"
That really threw Ashley off, sure she was all set to watch the relays and maybe participate if Sam wanted to but now here she was being asked by the manager of the company to be partners with him. She couldn't say no.
"That would be lovely" She replied. He held out his hand and Ashley grabbed it as he helped her up. They walked over to the relay section.
Meanwhile, Sam was purched on the hood of Ashely's Ford, leaning back with his sunglasses on smoking his cigarette.
He didn't even hear the guy approach.
"Hey there you are." Said the boy.
Sam was startled, as he grabbed his chest. "Oh, you scared me. I'm sorry but I forgot your name." Sam said as he took another drag of the cigarette.
"Pete." He replied. "Do you have another cigarette, mine are back at the picnic area?"
"Mine too" Sam replied. He handed the cigarette to Pete. He took a drag and handed it back to Sam.
"Is this your ride? Pete continued.
"Oh man, I wish. I don't have a car, or even a job. A lot of companies won't hire young people, even this company. I've been trying to get in for awhile. Hopefully something will come up soon" Sam explained.
"Well, my uncle is Patrick Stevens the company owner,, he's offered me jobs but I don't want to work with family. You should try the mall, that's where I work. I'm at the sporting goods place. It's over in the corner by Macy's and across from Dazzle Me, the dress store for teenaged girls." Explained Pete.
"Wow! I didn't know you were Mr Stevens Nephew, thats' cool. Yeah, maybe I'll try the mall soon. I have to really step up my game and get some kind of income." Explained Sam.
He handed the cigarette to Pete again as he took a drag and handed it back again.
"Do you like baseball Sam?" Pete asked.
"Love it!" replied Sam.
"Well I happen to have Giants season tickets, if you'd be interested in going to a game with me?" Pete asked.
"Are you kidding? I'd love that! Thanks a lot man" replied Sam.
"How does next weekend sound?" Pete continued.
"Saturday? Great! I've been wanting to see a game"
The conversation was interupted by an announcement from the distance. It was Mr. Stevens announcing that the relays were about to start and that all partners were to line up to be tied together.
The two finished the cigarette and then walked back together towards the playing field.
When they got there Sam saw all the relay racers having their legs tied together and right in the mix was Ashley being tied to Mr. Stevens.
"Haha, look at my uncle, what a goon." said Pete.
The crowd was thick and Sam was having a hard time seeing over everyone. So Pete suggested they get a closer look. He led Sam through the crowd towards the front of the relay line. He almost lost him, but quickly grabbed his hand and pulled him through.
"Thanks man", Sam said.
The race was about to start as the racers lined up. Ashley was laughing at something Mr. Stevens was saying and then the starting gun fired. The racers took off. All the couples started off together, but some teams broke away fast, one was Mr. Stevens and Ashley. But again, they were really laughing hard and other teams started to catch up to them. The crowd cheered as they watched.
They were all coming to the home stretch. It was still Mr. Stevens and Ashley in the front with two other teams right behind them. Ashley was really laughing so hard she couldn't stand anymore and she fell down laughing. Sam watched as Mr. Stevens grabbed her waist to help ease her fall. When they were both on the ground they continued to laugh as another team won the race.
Sam laughed at the sight but thought it was kind of strange that everytime Ashley tried to stand up Mr Stevens pulled her back down because they were tied together.
Just then Sam felt something. It was...
15533222212212.title: "After we eat theres going to be a 3 legged...

choices: All the band members are 21 so we have to make you look older
155332222122122.content:
Sam felt something being placed over his shoulders. He looked at his sides and saw that it was a large grey hoodie jacket. That swallowed him up.
"What's going on?" He looked and saw Pete behind him
"Sorry, I didn't mean to startle you, but when I pulled your hand through the crowd it was really cold, I thought you might want someone thing a little warm since it's a little later in the day." explained Pete.
Sam was a little startled by it but he was getting chilly. "Thanks man, that was cool."
He thought how everyone accepted him today, and that Ashley was worrying for nothing. He had met Ashley's boss when he got here. Played volleyball with some of her employees' kids, Met a cool kid Pete and even got invited to a baseball game for next weekend. I hope Ashley was having as much fun as he was he continued to think as he pulled the jacket a little tighter around him.
Behind him Pete began to smile. He watched Sam cuddle in his hoodie and thought. "This is the coolest girl I have ever met."
"I have to make her mine."
Sam looked back towards the relay races and didn't see Ashley or her boss anywhere. He saw the next relay which was a potato sack race lining up but he didn't see her in that race. He lifted his sunglasses off and put them up in his hair. Being it wasn't as sunny as it was.
"Pete, I'm going to take a walk to find my girlfriend. I don't see her anywhere.", Sam explained.
Pete thought Sam was talking about the other girl that they had played volleyball with and he saw her across the field. "I see her, she's over there, follow me." said Pete.
Sam followed Pete through the crowd of people once again. They walked past the roped off area for the relays until they got to another group of young adults. Here is where the other girl was, smoking with other guys her age.
Sam didn't realize that this is where they were going to stop, he thought they were going to find HIS girlfriend Ashley, but was easily distracted by the cigarettes.
Sam stopped in front of the girl, who was about the same size and height as Sam. "Can I please have a cigarette, I don't know where my pack is."
The girl opened her pack and pulled out 2 cigarettees and handed them to Sam and Pete. She pulled out a lighter and lit them both.
"I'm sorry, I'm terrible with names, what was yours again?"Sam asked.
"I'm Tiffany", she replied. Tiffany finally took a close up look at Sam's face. "Whoa! What happened to you?"
Sam looked at her surprised and had no idea what she was tallking about. "Why what's wrong?"
"Your eyeliner is running from having your sunglasses on all day." She explained.
"Oh man, that's right I forgot" replied Sam
"Come here, I'll fix you up." Tiffany explained.
Pete stood talking with the other guys as he watched Tiffany pull Sam away.
She pulled Sam by the hand to a picnic table and stood before him.
She sat her burning cigarette on the end of the table top. She dug in her purse and pulled out a comb.
"First I think this hair needs a comb run through it, let me reset your ponytail. She brushed Sam's hair a few times, and got behind him, She pulled his hair back and again tied the scrunchie around the ponytail and again it sat high on his head, looking much neater. "You should get your hair done and put a little body and style into it. My sister has a salon in town, I could set something up" Tiffany explained. Sam hadn't really thought about getting his hair done and didn't really want to go to women's salon either. Tiffany quickly changed the subject., "I love your earrings."
"Thanks!", replied Sam
She then dug in her purse and took out a cleansing pad. "Close your eyes."
Sam closed them and she wiped away all the eyeliner streaks under Sam's eyes. Sam took a drag from his cigarette and blew the smoke away from the girl. "I appreciate you cleaning up my eyes, I hope I didn't get smoke in yours."
"No problem, I couldn't leave you looking like that out there in that crowd." She was pointing to the crowd of guys they were standing with but it went right over Sam's head.
Then she took out her eyeliner and told Sam to look up. Sam obeyed as he felt her put eyeliner around his eyes.
She didn't stop there and dug in her purse again and pulled out black mascara. She twisted the wand and pulled it out. She began to coat Sam's lashes.
Sam knew what she was doing and commented on it. "Wow! I haven't worn anything on my eyes since my last gig."
After she finished and inspected her job, she took a drag of her cigarette again, "Your last gig?" She asked.
Sam also took a drag of his cigarette. "I played guitar in a band. Actually I wish I were still in a band."
The girl's eyes lit up. I have a band too. It's a bunch of girls I've known for awhile, we do cover songs of older girl rock bands. Some Lita Ford, Joan Jett, Pat Benetar. We play at a local pub every other Friday. This must be something that we met cause we're looking for a guitar player." Tiffany explained.
Now Sam's eyes lit up. "Oh man, that's great! I'd love to jam with you guys."
"I'd love to hear your sound, I have my guitar in the car, but no amp. Can you do some acousitc for now?" Tiffany continued.
"I'd love to, I was going to bring my guitar but was talked out of it." Sam explained.
"Oh I know what you mean, my mom didn't want me bringing mine either." replied Tiffany.
Let me run and get it. She grabbed her cigarette and ran towards her car.
Pete watched Tiffany run towards the car and approached Sam and sat next to him. "Did you scare her off with that dripping mascara? Pete smiled
Sam smiled and punched Pete in the shoulder.
"OW! Damn, you pack a punch!" Pete replied.
"See, I may be small...", replied Sam.
Pete got a good look at Sam's face after Tiffany worked on it. "Wow! You look much better."
All in all Sam thought Pete was a cool guy and he thought this was going to be a good start to a good friendship.
In a matter of minutes, Tiffany returned with a guitar case. and put it on the picnic table. She opened it and put the guitar that was inside on Sam's lap.
"Oh sweet! You're going to play?" Pete said. The other guys heard and came over, as did some of the other employees.
"Alright, lets hear." Tiffany said as she lit another cigarette.
Sam set the guitar on his lap upright and set his fingers in place.
He immediately went into what he knew and did some Bon Jovi songs. He went into Bad Medicine. Then mixed it up with a little Dead or Alive.
Tiffany was impressed as were the other guys.
"This girl can do it all, She plays guitar, loves sports and is super cute.", Pete thought.
Sam continued to play as some more people crowded over and listened to the teenage girl play.
"Who's daughter is that?" one woman asked.
One of the guys in the group the they played volleyball with replied, "It's the woman, Ashley's daughter.
"She plays really good. " She continued.
"Yeah and I hear she's only 17", he again replied.
Another woman chimed in, "I saw her with Mr. Steven's nephew. I think we have a match here at our little picnic."
"That's a 5 year difference in age cause isn't Pete 22?" she continued.
"She's not that young though." the women continued to talk as Sam played not hearing any of this.
Finally Tiffany stood up and said."Well, I'm impressed. Not that I didn't think you could play, but you're relaly good."
"Thanks!" Sam replied.
"So do you want to play in our band? We've got a gig on Friday night, I'd love it if you could play then.." she asked
"I would love to!" Sam was excited. He put the guitar back on the table and Tiffany gave him a hug.
One thing though...
155332222122122.title: Something else around Sam

choices: How about you and I go out
How about we work late on the Dazzle Me project.
1553322221221221.content:
"Sam, do you think you could meet me on Monday? This way you could meet the rest of the band and then we could go to one of the band members brother's house. He can get you a fake ID. He's got the whole setup, camera, laminator, the works. All we would have to do is fix you up a little and give you an older look." Tiffany explained as she pulled Sam's hair back a little more. "I think this could work." She continued. "Take my phone number down and let me know if it's ok with, you know who."Tiffany continued.
Tiffany had made that reference to Ashley who Tiffany thought was Sam's mother. Sam knew who she was talking about, "Oh, she won't mind. She's been working a lot lately and might even have to work that night. I can get out. " Sam replied innocently enough.
Tiffany took out a piece of paper and wrote her phone number on it and gave it to Sam. "If anything changes, let me know."
Sam smiled from ear to ear. "This is great! I've been wanting to jam again. Thanks a lot Tiffany!" he replied.
"My pleasure" she said as she grabbed for her guitar back, she rubbed Sam's hand during the exchange.
Sam didn't think anything of it and didn't even notice. He was happy enough that he was going to be playing again and even have a gig set up already. "I gotta go find... you know who?" Sam winked at Tiffany. Tiffany bit her lip and smiled.
Pete saw Sam was ready to walk away and called to Sam. "Hold up Sam, I'll walk with you." He said.
The two made their way through the crowd. The relay races looked like they were finished and a group of older office workers were near the food area drinking. Sam still had the hoodie on and as it was getting later, the more chilly Sam got. He had both hands in his pockets and hugged the large hoodie tight.
"Isn't that hoodie warm? It's my favorite." Pete said.
Sam stopped and turned around. He realized that Pete was stilll only in a tshirt and faced him and started to take it off. "I'm sorry dude, I'm hogging your hoodie and here you are getting cold."
Pete stopped Sam from removing his hoodie. He pulled his arm back through the sleeve and pulled at the neck of the hoodie for Sam to keep it on. He held it there for a few seconds and looked into Sam's eyes. "No, it looks better on you anyway." he said.
Sam looked up at Pete .
Pete thought they were sharing a moment, but Sam was looking elsewhere and finally spotted Ashley. "There she is!" he exclaimed as he looked past Pete's stare.
He broke away and started walking through a clearing of the crowd Sam had seen Ashley at one of the picnic tables. Mr Stevens and her sat on one side of the picnic table and another couple sat on the other side. Sam and Pete approached the table.
Ashley saw Sam coming over. "Hi sweetheart!" She said aloud.
Everyone's attention turned to Sam who stood at the end of the picnic table.
"Hi Sam, hi Pete." Said Mr.Stevens. He took the lit cigar out of his mouth and blew smoke the opposite way. "Are you guys having a good time?" He asked
"Yeah it's really a lot of fun." Said Pete. "A lot my people near my age this year."
Mr Stevens knew that his nephew meant Sam. He was glad that they had hit it off, and he saw that Sam had been wrapped in Pete's hoodie.
"It's pretty good" added Sam "I met a lot of cool people too."
Ashley got a good look at Sam's face and hair. "Sam must have redone everything." she thought. "He's got his hair recombed, and it looks like he's wearing makeup on his eyelashes as well as liner on his eyes. "this is going better than planned," Ashley continued to think in her head. "Once were done here, no one has to see Sam again, so she'll be in the clear with this lie and that will be that."
'Uncle Pat, can I have next saturday's lower level seats, Sam is going to go with me, if that's ok with you." Pete asked.
Mr Stevens took another hit of his cigar and shook his head up and down. "Well next Saturday I already have a client taking those. I do have tomorrow nights game free if that's ok? It's fine with me, It has to be ok with Ashley though." he continued.
Ashley's eyes lit up wide again. "Tomorrow?, for a game? Just the two of you?" She asked in a trance like state.
If Mr Steven's nephew got alone with Sam, he would surely try something. The kid has followed Sam around all day and clearly thinks that Sam is a teenage girl. A 17 year old teenage girl at that." Ashley thoughts scrambled about a mile a minute. "Oh why didn't I just clear things up and correct Mr. Stevens at the start of the day." She continued. to think.
"Is it ok Ashley?" Mr Stevens asked.
Ashley shook her head not even thinking or knowing what she was agreeing to.
"There you go, You guys are going to have a great time. Those are great seats. You just keep an eye on Sam, ok Pete." Mr Stevens said.
"Definitely!" Pete said as he put his arm around Sam and pulled him close.
Sam's face scrunched up against Pete's chest.
Ashley saw that Sam was about to say something and jumped in to change the subject.
"Do you want your cigarettes honey?" Ashley opened her purse and started to dig through
Sam pulled away from Pete, and pulled back his fist again being playful. "Don't make me give you some more of what I did before" He said with a smile.
"Oh yeah, damn, Sam can pack a punch." Pete held and rubbed his arm. "I'm still feeling it" Pete replied back playfully.
Sam grabbed at the pack of cigarettes but realized they were empty.
The ohter woman at the table saw this and asked Sam if he wanted one of her Virginia Slims.
Sam looked at the pack. That was always considered a "woman's cigarette" But He didn't care, so he reached into her pack and pulled out a long cigarette.
"Can I please have a light Mr. Stevens." Sam asked as he held the end in his lips.
Mr. Stevens' reached for his lighter and lit the flame and put it to the end of Sam's cigarette and lit it.
Ashley stared at Sam with one hand on his hip and the other holding a woman's cigarette very feminine like. He didn't realize it, but that's what he was doing.
"Comon', want to go down to the pond, I bet the flireflies will be coming out soon." Pete asked.
"Sure," Said Sam, and the two started to run off.
"I have a fireworks show that will start in about an hour, so come back around that time." Said Mr. Stevens
The couple ran off.
"I don't know Ashley. My nephew really seems to like your daughter. That's a five year difference, but this might be the start of something special." Mr Steven's joked.
The ohter woman at the table commented too. "The chemistry they have is amazing. You might be wedding gown shopping in a few years."
Ashley's eyes grew once more with fear.
"How am I going to keep this going." Ashley's mind raced. "Pete just had his arms all over Sam, he's dressing in his hoodie, how can they possibly go to a ballgame together? Sam thinks it's a ballgame and everyone else sees it as a date."
"Well, the thing is, Patrick. Sam doesn't date much and I would hate for a guy to be all over her." Ashley started to explain. "Not that your nephew wouldn't be the perfect gentlemen. She just hasn't kissed a boy yet and I just don't think she' s ready."
Mr. Stevens understood what Ashley was thinking. "I get it Ashley. I will have a talk with Pete and he will be on his best behavior and keep his hands to himself at all times." He explained.
Ashley thought, "it might work, but getting him out of the "Date" all together would be the best" "Maybe he'll catch the flu" She continued to think.
The other couple at the table excused themselves to go talk to other people and left the picnic table leaving Ashley and Mr Stevens alone.
"Well now that's settled, seeing that the kids are going out tomorrow night,".....
