choices: The guys and I had a water balloon fight.
15533222212212212.content:
"How about this", Mr Stevens began as he turned to face Ashley on the picnic bench.
"I can come over tomorrow night whien the kids leave for the game, I'll bring take out. We can eat and then we just crunch out a plan that we can bring to the Dazzle Me group and I could set up a meeting with them and then you could show them your talents and why were the number one ad agency, with the number one woman." He explained as he put his arm on Ashley's shoulder.
Ashley knew she had to get started on the ad for the Dazzle Me group right away, but she thought it would be later in the week.
Her mind was still racing frantically to think of a way to get Sam out of the "date" that he was going on tomorrow. Her plate was full already but now she had to worry about entertaining her boss and work on a project while her boyfriend was out dressed as a teenage girl on a date with a 22 year old boy.
"Ughhh, this spiraled out of control so quickly" she thought. "I just have to tell him the truth. I'll tell him and we'll laugh and everything will be ok from this point forward." She resolved in her head.
Ashley stared blankly while she was thinking all this.
"I see the concern in your eyes Ashley. I promise you, I will have that talk with Peter. Samantha will be perfectly safe going to the game with my nephew. I'll make sure of it. I know you worry about her and that's really nice to see a mother take an interest in her daughter's life." Mr Steven's explained.
Ashley turned to Mr. Stevens and smiled. "Tomorrow night is fine with me for you to come over but right now there's actually something I wanted to discuss with you." She began as she took a deep breath. "This was it" She thought. "I have to tell him"
Mr Steven's smiled. "Actually, I think I know what where you're going with this." Mr Steven's interupted.
"No Mr. Stevens I don't think you do, you see.." she started again.
Again Mr Stevens interupted. "Well I wasn't going to tell you this until all the paper work was ready on Monday, but remember those papers I spoke about when I told you about the account earlier? The ones I have to have you sign? Well, I talked the Dazzle Me executives to hire Samantha as one of the models for the new mailing brochure and also for a spot in the catalog in the under 20 year old group." He explained.
Ashley stared in shock.
"I knew you were worried about her not having a job so I looked into it and one of the Dazzle Me executives was here earlier for a brief time as the picnic begain. I asked her if she would use Samantha in her layout and she agreed. So not only do you get to design the whole ad, you get to work with your daughter. Isn't that wonderful?" He was really excited explaining this to Ashley, but she still didn't seem that excited.
Inside Ashley was freaking out. This is too much and I'm in so deep and the lie just kept growing," she had to tell him the truth, she thought to herself.
"She'll get a 500 dollars for every picture they use of her." Mr Stevens finished.
Ashley's eyes lit up. Mr Steven's smiled.
"I thought you might like that, and it would probably help you gals out with 2 incomes coming in. Also, She gets a $2000 clothing allowance. Dazzle Me not only has formal dresses, but a huge selection of teen girls clothes, shoes, accessories and makeup too. You would be set for awhile." He continued.
Ashley couldn't believe what Mr. Stevens was proposing but he just kept talking about it. "This could never happen" She thought. "It might have been easy to fool Sam to dress androdynous for a day, but theres no way he would ever wear girls clothes on purpose, especially at a job. The money would be good, but still I can't see anyway that this would work. she continued to think.
"Mr Stevens I appreciate this offer, but I'm not sure if I want Sam to get involved in modeling." Ashley explained.
"Well, why don't you tihnk about it. I'll still have the contract drawn up and I'll give it to you Monday and you look it over" Mr Steven's said.
Ashley didn't want to discuss this, she wanted to end this now.
Mr Steven's saw a woman wave over to him. "Oh look they're going to start the fireworks. Lets make our way to the field." Mr Stevens grabbed Ashley's hand and helped her unwrap her legs from the picnic bench. He held her hand through the crowd and made their way to the area with the microphone and big speaker. He picked up the microphone and flipped the switch on the speaker.
"Attention everyone, grab a blanket and a loved one, fireworks are set to begin in 10 minutes." He announced and then shut the speaker off again.
He leaned down and picked up a blanket that he had next to the speaker, along with a blue cooler that read P. STEVENS across the top. Again he grabbed Ashley's hand and made their way to the field area where just hours earlier they had the relay races.
He walked for a little while and decided on a spot deep on a hilly area. It was further than the other people but it was nice and secluded.
Ashley watched as he laid out the blanket and put the cooler on top of it. He laid down on the blanket and reached up his hand.
"Ashley, would you watch the show with me?" He smiled.
Ashley continued to stand. "thank you Mr. Stevens but..."
Mr Stevens again interupted, as he popped open the cooler. "I've got wine coolers." He smiled even larger.
Ashley finally smiled and kneeled on the blanket. "Well, maybe just one." She agreed.
Mr Stevens twisted the cap off of a wine cooler and handed Ashley the bottle. He twisted another one for him and then clicked bottles for cheers.
Mr Stevens reached into his shirt pocket for a cigar and his lighter. "Do you mind if I have a cigar?" He asked.
Ashley really didn't mind "I love the smell of a good cigar." She replied.
Secretly she did love the smell.. Years ago she worked as a bartender at a high end cigar bar. It was an exclusive club that served a lot of Arizona's high rollers.
Mr Stevens clipped off the end and lit the cigar. Ashley took a sip of her wine cooler.
She felt guilty sitting alone on a blanket with her boss, while Sam was being hit on by a young guy. She did like Mr Stevens from the beginning. He was the first one she had met at the office. Even before being interviewed. They rode the elevator up on the day of the interview and gave her a pep talk about the boss Mr Stevens and how he was a pushover but a nice guy. Then how surprised she was when she found out that Mr. Stevens was the guy from the elevator. They both had a good laugh about that and from there their friendship grew.
Mr Stevens was a single, confident man, and a year older than she was. He was very attractive and if she wasn't with Sam, she definitely thought about dating Mr. Stevens.
Mr Stevens surprised her by reaching around Ashley and placing the lit cigar at her lips.
Ashley turned and smiled. She put the cigar in her mouth and puffed. She blew the smoke away from them.
"That brings me back to a few years back in Arizona." She thought. She leaned in on the conversation as they both used the medium sized cooler as an arm rest.
"It's hard to find a good woman, who can appreciate a good cigar." Mr Stevens replied.
He puffed the cigar again and once again handed it to Ashley.
They both were distracted by a large boom
The fireworks had begun. They continued to smoke the cigar together and drink their coolers as the fireworks show was in full bloom. It seems, they talked more than actually watching a fireworks show.
That went on for practically the whole light show. Until about 25 minutes later when the finale started and the whole sky was lit up with fireworks. The watched and as the cigar got smaller, the show came to a close.
Everyone clapped, and the whole field got loud with lots of applause and cheers.
"I had an incredible time Mr Stevens." Ashley said.
"Please, enough with the formalaities. call me Patrick." He replied.
"Well, again, thank you Patrick." She said as she started to get up.
Mr Stevens got up and helped her to her feet.
They both turned and there stood Sam and Pete. Sam was soaked, clothes, hair, and everything.
"Sam! What happened?" Ashley asked.
15533222212212212.title: How about we work late on the Dazzle Me project.

choices: Sam was dressed androdynous again and ready for the ballgame.
Sam wore a thick bathrobe and had a thermometer in his mouth
155332222122122121.content:
Sam's teeth chattered like crazy as he wrapped his arms around Pete's soaked hoodie that was still on his back. He was freezing.
Ashley felt bad for Sam who stood there with his hair a mess, makeup running down his face and still in the wet clothes.
"How did this happen?" She asked.
Pete took over the storry as Ashley wrapped her arms around her smaller boyfriend.
"Sam was jumping on some rocks, it was like a path of rocks that crossed the pond. I followed almost a step behind. Well, it must have been a wet rock cause I really slipped off it and..." He told the story only Sam interjected the rest.
"Grabbed me around the waist and took me down with him." Sam sneered a little but laughed.
"Aww, man I said I was sorry." He replied smiling back.
Mr Stevens listened to the story and at first was mad that Pete had grabbed onto Samantha, but then he saw that they were being playful with each other, He thought to himself, "This boy really likes Samantha. I'll have to have that talk with him before the game tomorrow. I definitely want to stay on Ashley's good graces. This way Pete will end up with the girl and hopefully I'll end up with the woman!" He startied smirking too.
"Well, the picnic is jjust about winding down, so why don't you take the keys and walk to the car and maybe get it warmed up a little." Ashley handed Sam the keys.
"I'll go with you Sam, until you're ready to go." Pete followed.
"Try not to pull me into any lakes along the way" Sam said sarcastically laughing
Pete just mocked Sam's laughter and the two ran towards the car.
Ashley turned around and saw Mr Stevens putting away the wine coolers into the cooler.
"here let me grab an end, and we'll fold it together." She said as she grabbed the blanket that they sat on.
The two folded the blanket together.
"So tomorrow night, are we still on?" Mr Steven's asked.
Ashley thought about it more and she really couldn't have her home life and work life mix anymore. She almost had a heart attack tonight trying to keep her work people away from Sam. Not to mention she never used a single pronoun when talking about Sam tonight, there's just no way she could do another day of this.
"I will call you tomorrow." She told him
"Ok, fair enough" As they folded the last part of the blanket, the two were close and as she handed the blanket to him. Mr. Stevens rubbed at her hand. "I hope you call" He smiled.
It caused Ashley to also smile, but then quickly remembered Sam was waiting in the car.
"I have to go" She told him as she walked away.
"Goodnight Ashley." He said as she crossed the field.
Many of the other eomployees made their way over to Mr Stevens to thank him for a good time.
But Mr. Steven's stare never left Ashley as he watched her walk away.
As Sam and Ashley pulled out of the park, Ashley saw Sam was a little warmer with the heat on. He had turned it up full blast, and she couldn't take it anymore finally turning it down to low.
"Did you have a good time babe?" Ashley asked him
"It was a blast! I didn't realize a lot of people my age would be there. Which reminds me, you weren't mad that I didn't hang out with your work people all night, were you?" He asked.
"No babe, I'm just glad you had a good time" She replied.
Sam was really smiling. "I met a lot of cool people AND, just like your amazing news about The Dazzle Me project. I might be joining a new band." He finally told her.
Ashley again got that feeling of strain on her chest. "What?"
Sam replied, "Yeah, the chick Tiffany who was there? She brought her guitar out for me to play and she liked my sound so much, she asked me to play in her girl band this coming weekend. Can you believe that? I'm going to be rocking in a band again." He continued.
Ashley started to freak out again. "Are you sure that's a good idea honey? Shouldn't you be looking for a job?" She knew Sam was going to freak out about her bringing up a job, but she had to get his mind off doing these things with people who thought all along that he was a girl.
"That's the best part. It's a paying gig. If they like me, which I think they will it could lead to other gigs." He replied too excited to be upset about her comment.
Ashley started freaking out internally again. She thought about everything the rest of the ride home as Sam conintued to talk about all the people at the picnic that he met.
"This is going to be a great week. I get to see a ballgame tomorrow and then later in the week I get to jam in a band." Sam said. He left out the part about the fake ID that he would need to play in the bar. He was still underage even though the other girls were over 21, but they would help him get in. He thought.
The couple arrived home got inside the house. Ashley went into the bedroom and stripped out of her clothes and slid into some PJ's.
She heard the shower go on and knew that Sam was jumping in. She shut the light out and slipped into bed.
About 15 minutes later as Ashley still lay there thinking about her lie and and what Sam was involved in, she heard the water shut off.
Minutes later Sam was slipping into the bed. His small body held onto her. His arms reached around and he started caressing her breasts.
After a few minutes, they two made love and then fell asleep.
The next morning, Ashley's eyes opened and faced Sams side of the bed. Only it was empty.
She sat up and pulled her hair back.
"Babe?" she called.
Sam entered the bedroom doorway and Ashley gasped.
155332222122122121.title: I fell in the pond

choices: Ashley, Pam, Mr Stevens and Pete
1553322221221221212.content:
The clock read 11 am.
Ashley saw Sam who was in a fluffy robe, Ashley's big fluffy slippers on his feet. His hair was damp and pulled back into a ponytail. He had a thermometer sticking out of his mouth and was grasping onto a freshly made cup of tea.
"Oh no! Sam, you poor baby!" she got out of bed and helped in guiding Sam to the edge of the bed to sit.
Ashley put her fingers in his long hair just as the thermometer started to lightly beep. The reading was done and she pulled the thermometer out of his mouth.
"Oooh, 102 degrees." She felt his forehead. "You're burning up babe." She put the thermometer on the nightstand and helped guide the cup of tea into Sam's mouth.
He took a sip.
"I woke up about an hour ago sweating, with a sore throat and stuffy nose. I thought a shower would help, but I feel even worse. I don't have much of a voice either." Sam explained in a raspy nasaly broken voice.
Ashley propped up some of the pillows and helped Sam lean back on his side of the bed. She put the cup of tea next to the bed and pulled up the covers to Sam's chin.
"Well babe, I'm sorry to say that you won't be going to any ballgames like this." Ashley said.
Sam didn't like the sound of that. "Well, I figured the game isn't until late afternoon and if I slept the afternoon away, I would wake up alright for the game." Sam explained.
Ashley smiled but knew that there would be no way for Sam to go to this ballgame. She finally felt a little relief after the day before being in a constant panic mode. Now she could tell Mr. Stevens that their work/dinner plans were off for the evening and that the "kids" wouldn't be going out that night. After a few more excuses and cancellations by her and, Samantha will be a distant memory from her office friends.
"Well, lets see how you feel later" Ashley said giving Sam a little hope.
Ashley got up from the bed and went into the bathroom. She opened the medicine cabinet and saw a full bottle of NyQuil cold and flu Nighttime. She took the dosage cup and filled it to the rim, giving Sam a double dosage.
"This should do it and put him out for the rest of the day." She thought as she carried the dosage back to Sam.
She again sat on the edge of the bed near Sam and handed him the dosage cup full of the medicine.
"Here, take this." She said handing him the medicine cup.
Sam didn't argue, he just took the cup and downed it quickly. Then he made a yucky medicine face as she handed him the cup of tea again. Again she ran her fingers through his hair and took the cup of tea back after his sip. She guided him back down to the pillows.
"I'm going to jump into the shower babe. Get some rest." Ashley said as she left him and entered the bathroom.
After her shower and when she was finished getting dressed she peeked into the bedroom again and saw that Sam was out like a light.
Quietly she closed the bedoom door and went into the kitchen. She grabbed her cell phone and dialed her sister Pam.
Pam was the older of the two sisters but they were very much the same build. Both very tall attractive women, and they had always been very close except recently as Pam didn't care much for Sam. It wasn't so much the age difference. She saw him as a slacker, who had no direction. He was a long haired musician. She knew het sister liked the badass musician guys growing up but now thought it was time to find the guy who was going to be in it for the long haul. Sam didn't seem like that guy to her. She did want to start having a better relationship with her sister like they used to have so she continued to be there for her and support her choice in men.
"I was wondering if I was going to hear from you. How was the picnic?" She said as she answered her phone.
"Oh my God Pan, do I have a story to tell you." Ashley began.
That's exactly what Ashley did. She explained the whole picnic and the whole misunderstanding and everything that went down at the picnic. A few hours later and Pam was in hysterics after hearing everything.
"Oh God Ash, I don't know how you get pulled into this craziness, but I swear the kid causes you more headaches" She replied.
"So what time is Mr Steven's coming over?" Pam asked.
"Pam, are you serious? There's no way I can meet with Patrick today while Sam was out with his nephew. I can't do another day of this.I"m just going to have to cancel tonight and then hopefully we can figure something out Monday morning at the office."
"No way!" Pam yelled. "I'm coming over"
Just a little before 3 pm Sam stirred in his bed. He turned over and faced the clock that was on the nightstand and saw that It was 4 pm. He had slept the whole afternoon away. He heard voices in the other room and slowly he got out of bed. He opened the door of the bedroom and entered the living room area and saw..
1553322221221221212.title: Sam wore a thick bathrobe and had a thermometer...

choices: Pam forged Ashley's signiture on the contract
The two thought of a way this could work
15533222212212212122.content:
Sam crept towards the bedroom door. He was just about to open it when he realized there was something that was different, and that difference was him.
He remembered going to sleep in a robe but that's not what he had on now. He could only see by looking down because there wasn't a mirror in the room.
First of all he felt a ballcap on his head. He did try to remove it but realized that his hair was in a ponytail and it fed through the back of the hat.
He looked at his shirt which was a grey hoodie with the San Francisco Giants Logo on the front of it. The peculiar thing about the chest area where the logo sat, it pertruded out in the front. It felt like he had on something under the hoodie around his chest. He tried to pull the zipper down but it was stuck. He looked down at it and it had a bunch of material jammed up together, so it wasn't going to zipper down.
The hoodie sat on his hips in an almost hugging way and on his lower half was a pair of white short shorts. They were really short. Finally on his feet were a pair of open toed sandles.
He heard a group of people on the other side of the door and he heard Ashley say, "I'll go check if Sam is up yet"
After he heard that, the door slowly opened and Ashley peaked her head in. She was in shock to see Sam there on the other side of the door.
"Oh, you're up? How long have you been up?" She asked nervously.
Sam tried to reply but all that came out was a high pitch screach. Sam had lost his voice.
Ashley smirked and thought. "Oh this is perfect."
Sam grabbed at his throat.
"Oh baby, I'm sorry, you can't talk."
Sam motioned at his clothes and mouthed, "what is this?"
Ashley explained. "Oh I'm sorry babe. Mr Steven's and Pete called while you were sleeping and said they were coming over at around 3. I tried a few times to wake you up but you didn't budge. My sister and I finally decided to start getting you ready ourselves. I even did your eye makeup that I know you like to have the "rockstar" look", she continued.
Sam's eyes opened widely and he mouthed, Your sister?"
Ashley laughed, "No, my sister didn't dress you. I did. She bought you the new clothes. She heard you were going to the Giants game and got you some new gear to wear. Does it fit ok babe?" She asked.
Sam made a motion that it was tight in the chest and then he made his hands symbolize breasts.
"Oh, yeah. I have another layer under your hoodie. Just because youre going to the game doesn't mean you're 100 percent well, you were really sick and I don't want you catching more cold, so I wrapped you up warm." She explained.
"Comon', everyone is waiting for you, lets go out there so you can get to the game." Ashley said as she walked out of the bedroom. Sam followed behind her.
Everyone smiled as they came into the room. Pete, who was sitting on the couch stood up and smiled at Sam. Sam smiled back at his friend.
Only Pete was smiling at Sam because he looked like a beautiful girl.
Ashley wasn't entirely honest with Sam. It was true that her sister and her got him dressed while he slept, but they dressed Sam up like an attractive teenaged girl.
What Sam couldn't see, was that a pink Giants hat sat on his head. The two sisters had done his hair in a striaight ponytail and fed it through the back of the hat. His top was an ash colored women's front zippered Giants hoodie. The two sisters jammed the zipper intentionally so that Sam couldn't see that underneath the hoodie he had on a woman's bra with two of Sam's socks stuffed into the cups. His chest pertruded enough to give him a small B cup. On his hips were white women's shorts and on his feet was an opened toe women's sandle with a slight heel.
Ashley did put eyeliner on Sam's eyes but she failed to mention that she added a light foundation, light eye shadow and pink lipstick.
Pam also thinned his eyebrows slightly just to give them al ittle shape.
Ashley knew Sam wasn't one to stare into a mirror. He usually got out of the shower and put his hair in a ponytail and threw on his clothes. So she knew he wouldn't see himself. Now she felt even better that Sam couldn't speak.
Pam took her phone out of her purse. "You two kids get together so that I can take your picture."
Mr Steven's took his phone out of his pocket also and set it up for a picture.
"Get close you two!" Pam insisted.
Pete stood facing her ready for a picture. Sam just wanted to get going, but finally stood next to Pete.
Pam couldn't believe the difference in height and build between the two boys. Sam came up to Pete's chest and his small frame was nothing compared to Petes athletic toned body.
Pete put his arm around his "date" and both smiled as the IPhones snapped a picture.
"Now one more, but this time both of you yell GO GIANTS!" Pam continued.
Sam posed and put a snarl on his face. With the makeup on and his outfit, he looked like a cute girl Giants fan pointing to his shirt. Pete also pointed to his shirt which was a Giant's Jersey. Both of them yelled, "GO GIANTS!" In unison.
Ashley came over to Sam with another dosage cap full of Nyquil cold and flu. "I know you still don't feel 100 percent but lets keep up with the medicine, take this."
Sam downed the cap of medicine and made the face. While he did that, Ashley tied something around his waist.
"I couldn't find your fanny pouch so you'll have to use mine. I put your cigarettes, a lighter and sunglasses in there. There might be some things of mine in there, but I didn't have time to take them out." Ashley explained as Sam made a face.
Everyone thought Sam was upset about not having his fanny pack, but he was really making the face because Ashley's was pink.
"We better get rolling, Sam I have some friends we're meeting there, and I want them to meet you before we sit at our seats." Pete explained.
The two exited the apartment and walked to the driveway where Petes blue convertable Mustang sat. The top was already down.
Pete opened the car door for Sam, and after Sam sat down Pete closed the door and went around to the driver's side.
Sam unzipped the fanny pack and saw that there were sunglasses in there, only they were Ashley's women sunglasses. "Great!" Sam thought. He pulled them out and put them on. He saw everyone standing in the apartment doorway watching them leave and he pointed to the sunglasses with a frown on his face.
Everyone just waved to them as Sam pulled out a cigarette and lit it as Pete backed out of the driveway.
The pair looked just like a young boy and girl out on a first date.
The others walked back into the apartment.
"I' had that talk with Pete, he is going to take real good care of Samantha tonight." Mr Steven's explained.
Pam laughed as she heard that. "Oh she's a big girl. I have to tell you, I see a future for those two. They're so cute together." Pam continued
Ashley nudged her as Mr. Steven's back was turned.
"Well, I should be going." Pam started.
Mr. Steven's went to a briefcase that was on the kitchen table and opened it and took out some papers. "Actually Pam, I was hoping you could help me pursuade Ashley here to allow her daughter to model for the Dazzle Me project. I have a new contract right here all you have to do is sign and Samantha could make a lot of money." He explained.
Pam grabbed the contract as Ashley's sighed. "Oh Mr Steven's I thougth we went through this, I don't want Sam involved in any of this."
"I know, and I swear I'm not pushing but I didn go back to the Dazzle Me people and told them that Samantha wasn't interested, and they actually upped the ante." He continued. "It would still be cheaper for them to offer Sam more money than it would to pay for another professional model. These people are good too, they work with the models and it's all very positive."
Ashley thought, Here it was happening again. She was getting pulled into a lie and it was dragging out farther. There isn't anyway this would work. Sure, she got Sam to go out again tonight looking like a girl without a hitch,but this was definitely the last night. She couldn't keep doing this to her boyfriend, plus he would eventually get his voice back and once he found out what was going on, he would be furious with her.
"Sam would never go for it anyway, you saw how she is getting her picture taken. She hates it, so there would be no way that she would pose in dresses and heels. She's too much of a tomboy." Ashley explained.
"TEN THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR A TWO WEEK JOB?" Pam screamed as she read the contract. Ashley came over and started reading over Pam's shoulder.
"I got them to offer 10 grand, 500 per photo used, a two thousand dollar clothing allowance and free madeovers at the Dazzle Me Spa for 6 months. That's a lot of money they're offering a nobody." Mr Stevens expllained.
Ashley looked at her sister.
Pam asked if she could talk to her sister for a few minutes in the other room.
Mr Stevens agreed.
The two women exited the living room and went into the bedroom and closed the door.
15533222212212212122.title: Ashley, Pam, Mr Stevens and Pete

choices: I hope I get a kiss soon
I hope she agrees to be my girlfriend
155332222122122121221.content:
Pam and her sister walked into the bedroom and closed the door behind them.
"Oh my God, Oh my God, Oh my God. I"m going to hell" Ashley put her hands to her face and covered them walking around the room in a panic.
"Oh stop, it's harmless." Pam tried to justify what they did.
Ashley looked at her sister. "Pam, we dressed my boyfriend up in women's clothes and sent him on a date with a young guy, I'm a terrible girlfriend. I'm soooo going to hell." She continued.
"Well to be honest, the clothes were more androdgynous than women's." Pam smiled.
"We put him in a bra while he slept, and I let you pluck some of his eyebrows." Was her reply.
This made Pam laugh even harder. "Hey! I straightend some stray hairs for him."
Ashley picked up the contract that Mr Stevens brought over. "And this, I have no clue what to say about this. I've told him no, but he keeps insisting that I sign it."
Pam looked at her sister with a little smirk. "I think he's got a crush on you, and is trying to do anything to be able to work with you and your daughter." She explained.
Ashley put on a "You're crazy" face and said, "There's no way, you're crazy. He just wants Sam and I to be able to work together, and that if Sam took this modeling job it would help out with some of the bills."
"Well, say what you like, I think he likes you and wants to do things that will help you out and to make you happy." Pam explained.
"That's very nice of him, but I am with Sam and he is my boyfriend." Ashley replied.
"Who's out on a date right now with his nephew." Pam threw in.
Ashley laid on the bed and covered her face in the comforter.
Pam picked up the contract. "I better get going so you two can have some time to do some work. So what are you going to do about this contract?"
Ashely spoke with her face still in the comfortor. "Can you tell him no for me, please. He won't take my "No" for an answer. Tell him, I'll be right out, I want to freshen up a little." Ashley stood up from the bed. and went into the bathroom.
"I'll take care of it. See ya later, sis." Pam said.
"Bye Pammy" Ashley said from behind the bathroom door.
Pam walked back out to the living room area. Pam walked over to the table and picked up a pen. She brought the contract over to Mr Stevens and signed Ashley's name on the contract for Sam to model for Dazzle Me.
She whispered to Mr Stevens. "Ashley says no, but I know that she really needs this. Call me, I put my number at the bottom of the contract.
I'll get Samantha to the photo shoot, but we can't tell Ashley until after the fact. Sam is going to be reluctant so that's why Ashley nor you can be at the shoot." Pam explained
"That's fine, my brother, Peter's dad is the photographer. He'll take good care of her." Then Patrick smiled. "He is also very single, maybe I could tell him you're stopping by and you two can get to know each other better. Then maybe the four of us could have dinner soon." He proposed.
Pam smiled, "Well, if he is as cute as you, I'm in."
So we have a deal?!" Mr Steven's asked.
Pam shook his hand, "Deal."
Pam left and before Ashley came out of the bedroom, Mr Stevens put the contract into his briefcase again.
Meanwhile at the Giants game.
Sam and Pete finally parked. Pete had parking passes which was really good because it allowed them to park right outside the entrance gate.
They wouldn't have to walk far, when the game was over, but Pete really didn't mind walking especilly next to Sam.
The two walked to the trunk of the car and Pete opened it up. He pulled out 2 foldable chairs. Both in Giant's colors. He opened Sam's seat for him and patted it for him to sit down.
Sam smiled and sat on his chair. It was a large chair and because Sam wasn't that big, he curled up his legs into the seat.
Pete noticed how cute Sam looked especially sitting like that as he opened his chair.
He dug back into the trunk of the car and took out two beers.
He twisted both tops off and handed one to Sam.
He sat down in his chair.
"That sucks that you lost your voice." Pete said after he took a sip from his bottle.
Sam shrugged his shoulders.
"I wanted you to be able to interact with my friends that are coming.." Pete continued.
Pete pulled out two cigarettes and lit them. He exhaled the smoke and then handed one to Sam.
Sam smiled and took the cigarette and a sip of beer.
Both turned when they heard a car horn honking approaching and turned to see 2 more cars pull up.
In one car were 2 more couples and in another car was another couple. Pete thought this was great. It was going to be 4 couples if you count Sam and him.
The other groups all got out of the car and came over and greeted each other. There was Mike and Rebecca, Steve and Gina, and Rob and Darlene.
Sam waved to everyone as Pete explained that Sam had no voice. He laughed when he said they fell in the pond last night together.
Sam, pushed Pete in the shoulder, playingly.
Sam noticed the other guys were all big guys too. He was probably the smallest guy in the group. The girl Gina was really tall also.
She was the same height as the other guys and her guy Steve. He was the same height as Rebecca, but taller than Darlene.
He felt a little self conscious but everyone was really nice and it didn't take long before everyone started talking.
The other guys started unloading chairs out of their car trunks and coolers with beers.
Gina had unfolded a small table and Rebecca opened a dip and put it on the table. Another guy came over with 3 different chips.
They filled plastic bowels with chips as everyone made a circle of chairs around the table and dug in.
Rob came over with a large cooler from his trunk and set it next to the table, while Darlene handed out paper plates to everyone.
Rob opened the cooler and took out a long submarie sandwich for everyone. It was cut into pieces so everyone dug in.
Everyone made small talk and seemed to focus the conversation a lot around Sam.
Sam of course could only answer the group's questions by shaking his head yes or no. Like when they asked how long he's lived there. Sam could only hold up the number of fingers. Pete did a lot of the talking about Sam. He told everyone about the mean guitar Sam played and how there was a gig coming up on Friday that the band was going to play in. Everyone right away asked where and if they could come see the band play.
Sam nodded.
Pete said, "When we find out where the band is playing I'll get in touch with everyone mid week."
Everyone liked that idea.
The tailgate party went on for awhile, and the beers seemed to start hitting Sam hard. He was really feeling loopy and kind of dizzy, but he didn't want to show it.
THen he remembered the NYQUIL that he had taken before he left. He mixed that with alcohol and that's why he was feeling weird.
Sam paniced a little cause he was feeling a little drunk and really didn't know Pete or his friends that well.
It did seem like Pete's friends were getting a little buzzed from the alcohol too. The girls were laughing a lot, but it was Darlene who was getting loud and more obnoxious as they partied.
"Oh my God, I have to pee!" Darlene announced. "Come to the port a john with me Sam." She yelled.
Sam wondered why she wanted him to go with her, but he figured maybe they could help each other out.
As Darlene and Sam walked away everyone commented on how pretty Samantha was.
Rebecca said, "I think you two make such a cute couple. I hope it works out."
"Two things might be a problem though, one is that she's only 17. The other thing is her mother is very protective of her. She works with my uncle and she made him have a talk with me about taking care of Sam tonight." Pete explained.
"Well, she seems to really be into you and that's reallly not a major age difference between you two. Just treat her right and her mom won't have any reason to worry." Rebecca replied.
"I will, I could definitely see a long term relationship with this girl." Pete said.
The whole group of friends in unison gave a dragged out and sarcastic, "Awwwww"
Pete smiled but then realized the time. "We better get packed up and get the other girls to go in."
Sam and Darlene were making their way back to the cars and they were walking slowly. They were both leaning on each other for support to walk. Darlene was really drunk and Sam had a few beers but he was really loopy, lightheaded and things were getting a little blurry for him.
They approached the other friends at the cars and saw they were ready to go in.
"It looks like the girls could use a little help." Rob noticed.
Pete ended up hanging on to Sam as Rob grabbed Darlene.
"Comon guys we have to go in." Pete said. Drunken Sam leaned up against Pete's chest.
"Oh no, Sam. Are you going to be alright."
Sam shook his head yes but he was feeling very intoxicated. Whether it be from the beers or the Nyquil. He was going to have to take it easy for the rest of the game and let this buzz wear off.
"Sam took some Nyquil before we left, so that and the beers aren't mixing well." Pete explained to his friends.
"Aww, you poor thing." Rebecca said.
Pete leaned down and told Sam to jump on his back. "Comon, lets just get to our seats and I'll get you something to eat."
Sam leaned against Pete's back and sort of flopped on it. Pete grabbed Sam's legs and hoisted him up on his back.
Sam's mind was racing. The medicine and beers weren't a good mix.
He had thoughts about when he and Ashley had gone to a game together. They had so much fun. He remembered both of them drinking a lot at the game and he got on her back just like he is now.
He forgot for a moment that he was on Pete's back and not Ashleys as he locked his arms snuggly around Pete's neck and leaned in against his cheek.
Pete smiled and thought..

1553322221221221212211.content:
Pete walked proudly through the gated areas surrounding the ballpark with Sam on his back. The other couples followed as they made their way past the food stands. That's where Pete decided to come to a stop. He stood up straight, sliding Sam down his back. When his feet hit the ground, Sam came to life, but leaned against Pete's body.
Pete opened his pocket and took out the tickets for everyone.
"I'm going to get Sam something to eat and some coffee to wake her up, anybody else need anything?" He asked his friends.
Everyone agreed that they wanted nothing except beer and they would get that at another stand. They grabbed their tickets and went on their way to the seats.

Sam's head was really floating. He hadn't been this sick and out of it in a long time.
"Ashley's jacket is so soft" Sam thought to himself as his face was planted into Pete's chest. "Mmm, I smell hotdogs." He thought as he finally opened his eyes and facing the stand.
He tried to talk and tell Ashley that he wanted a hotdog. He opened his mouth and remembered that he had lost his voice. What really threw him off was when he turned around and instead of seeing Ashley at the game, he saw Pete.
"Oh that's right, I'm with Pete and his friends" He thought to himself. "I am so out of it."
He smiled at Pete and then leaned against him. "Wow, Pete's jacket is really soft too, just like Ashley's was."
"Sam, I think you have a fever. When you were leaning on me, I could tell that you were burning up." Pete tried talking to Sam, but Sam just made a sad face.
"Do you want something to eat, maybe that will help?" he asked.
Again Sam just made a sad face and then leaned on him again.
Sam heard Pete order him a hot dog. Sam opened his eyes again and looked up, seeing Pete and he worded "I LOVE YOU!" to him.
Pete smiled and felt really good. He wrapped his arms around Sam body from behind.
Sam felt comfortable and leaned his head against Pete's face.
"I love when Ashley cuddles me like this", he thought as he felt safe in her arms.
Pete loved that Sam was comfortable enough to let him hold her like this and that she pressed her face against his. He hesitated but then took a chance and turned his head to face hers and kissed her slowly on the cheek.
He saw Sam smile at this.
Pete saw that the 2 hotdogs and drinks that he ordered were ready so he released his hold on Sam and reached for his wallet.
Again Sam opened his eyes to see what happened and where Ashley went. He turned around and saw Pete paying for food.
"Oh yeah, I keep forgetting I'm not here with Ashley." He remembered. "It's hard to think though, especially when it's only been Ashley and I doing stuff together alone for the longest time since we moved here." he continued trying to think straight.
Pete walked with Sam after he payed and brought his date over to a bench that no one was sitting at. He placed Sam down and then sat right next to her. Sam leaned against Pete again.
Pete had the food tray on his lap and he handed Sam a hot dog.
Sam took the hotdog and looked at it and saw it was plain.
Pete saw her staring at the hotdog. "Did you want ketchup for it?"
Sam nodded his head.
"Ok, I'll be right back, are you going to be alright sitting here for a few seconds?" Pete asked.
Sam again nodded.
Pete got up and made his way over to the food fixen's area.
Sam snapped out of it for a second but once again his eyelids got really heavy.
"This reminds me of that rain delay game Ashley and I went to." Sam started to think. "We spent 45 minutes by the food stands waiting for the storm to pass us by. I remember it was one of the best make out sessions we ever had. God I love her, she is so sexy." He continued to think.
When Pete came back he approached the bench and saw Sam with her eyes closed but with a big smile on her face. She was wobbling back and forth and it looked like she was going to sway backwards right off the bench.
Pete quickly ran to her and leaned down behind her just as she started going back.
She did just that, and landed right into Pete's arms.
"Oh good Ashley's back" Sam thought as he felt her again holding him. It was really hard for him to keep his eyes opened so he kept them shut.
"Maybe I should just surprise her with another make out session while we wait for the game to start." He thought.
As Pete lifted Sam's smaller body frame up and with Sam still in his arms he faced the opposite direction of the bench and had Sam sitting on his lap. To his surprise Sam grabbed Pete's head from behind the neck and pulled him in close. His lips smashed against Sam's as Sam started kissing him hard.
Pete of course put up no struggle as he slowed Sam's pace down a little. He grabbed Sam's face and kissed Sam's lips slowly. Sam parted his lips and allowed Pete to insert his tongue.
Pete inched his hand up to Sam's chest and slowly started touching his breasts. He thought to himself that they felt so soft.
Of course unknown to him, it was reallly a sock under Sam's trapped hoodie, that Pete was caressing.
Then thoughts streamed through Pete's head about Sam's mom and how she told his uncle that she didn't want anything to happen to Sam and then the talk that Pete's uncle had with him, and how he didn't want him even kissing her.
"Damn" He thought as he pulled his lips away from Sam.
Sam was stuck in make out mode and again pulled Pete's head close and continued kissing him.
Pete stood up off the bench with Sam still in his arms and attached at the lips and then put Sam down on the bench and then sat down himself.
"mmmm, I love Ashley's lips." Sam thought.
Pete snapped Sam out of it as he once again put the hotdog in his date's hands.
Sam looked down and saw the hotdog. His head was really cloudy and he couldn't focus. He saw someone putting a ketchup packet across the top of the hotdog.
"Comon' you have to get something in your stomach besides NyQuil and beer." Pete said as he made Sam take a bite of the hotdog.
Sam did bite the hotdog and then looked next to him as he started to chew.
He quickly became aware of his surroundings and looked around behind him. "Where's Ashley?" he thought. "Oh shit, I really am out of it, I keep thinking I'm here with Ashley." Sam tried clearing his head as he chewed the hotdog.
"mmm, Pete's right though, this hotdog hits the spot." Sam thought as he took another bite.
Pete and Sam sat and ate their hotdogs on the bench. Sam stayed focused while he ate.
He opened the top off the coffee and saw that it was black coffee, he nudged Pete's arm and without words pointing to inside the coffee and then raised his shoulders.
"Oh, you need cream and sugar?" Pete asked.
Sam nodded.
"I'll be right back." Pete got up and ran to the fixin area again.
Sam's throat really hurt and his lips were dry. He opened up his fanny pack and pulled out what looked like chapstick.
Still unable to focus, what Sam was pulling the cap off of was a nude color lipstick that belonged to his girlfriend Ashley.
As Pete approached Sam, he saw that Sam was alert and applying lipstick to her lips. "She looks fabulous!", he thought to himself.
Sam finished applying the lipstick and put the tube back into his fanny pack. He pursed his lips to make sure that the chapstick was on both lips.
"Oh man, her lips look so good. I just want to kiss her again, but I have to control myself." He thought as he reached the bench.
"So what do you say, we go and catch this game." Pete said to Sam.
Sam looked up and saw his friend. He got up and still with a cloudy head and leaning into his buddy and they went to find their seats.
Sometime later while Sam and Pete were still at the game. Mr. Stevens was just finishing up putting his papers away. Ashley also was cleaning up bowls and glasses that the two of them had used.
"I loved the ideas you have for this project Ashley. You are amazing for this job, I'm really lucky to have you on my team." Mr Stevens said as he continued to clean up.
Thank you Patrick, that means a lot to me. I really enjoy my job and I can't wait to get going on "Dazzle Me." She replied as she started to take thier wine glasses off the table.
"Should I open another bottle of wine? We have a little more time til the kids'game ends."Ashley asked.
"Only if you join me in one of these." Mr Steven's replied as he pulled out a fresh cigar from his breast pocket.
Ashley liked that idea. "We could go sit out on the front balcony and wait for them there." Ashley said.
"Great!" Mr Steven's carried the glasses and Ashley carried out the wine and the two stepped out onto the balcony.
There was a small table there and two chairs right next to each other.
After they both sat. Ashley grabbed the two glasses and filled them. While Patrick bit off the end of the cigar and clicked open his zippo and lit the large cigar.
He puffed on it a few times and then handed it to Ashley who expertly did the same.
The two talked and laughed for awhile as they realized they had a lot in common.
"I love a woman who can appreciate a good cigar." He said.
"Well I haven't really been around anyone who liked to smoke them so I haven't in awhile." Ashley replied.
"Does your daughter know you like them?" Patrick asked.
"She knows I have in the past but doesn't like them." She replied.
"How did Samantha start smoking? Was there a guy in your life that smoked around her growing up?" Mr Steven's asked subtly.
"No, no other man. It's just been Sam and I for a long time. I guess she just sort of picked it up" Ashley replied. She knew where Patrick was going with this and she was a little worried only because she's had a few glasses of wine already in her and she didn't want to say the wrong thing.
"well, you just have to wait for the right guy. A guy that will appreciate you." he said and then smiled. "A guy that is the same height as you." He glanced at Ashley as he hinted at that and she smirked.
Headlights suddenly shined on the two, it was...

15533222212212212122111.content:
Pete's car pulled into the driveway of Sam and Ashley's apartment. He hadn't seen his uncle or Ashley smoking their cigar on the front patio as he got out of the car and ran around to the passenger side of the car.
He opened the car door and kneeled down.
Seconds later he stood back up with a passed out Sam in his arms.
He kicked the passenger door closed with his foot and walked to the stairs that led up to the apartment.
Mr. Steven's made himself known as he saw his nephew carrying Sam.
"Is she alright?" He asked as he met him at the top of the stairs.
Pete was startled as he finally saw his uncle and Ashley. "She's burning up." He replied.
Mr Stevens grabbed the sleeping Sam from Pete's arms.
Ashley opened the door and Mr Stevens followed her in.
Once inside Ashley tried to grab Sam from her boss' arms. "I'll take her from here."
"Nonsense, she is really light, where is her bedroom?" He asked.
Ashley didn't want Mr Stevens to see that Sam's bedroom was also her bedroom so she led him over to the couch. "Just set her here."
Ashley was finally relieved when Mr Stevens put Sam down because he would really feel stupid to see her boss carrying him to bed.
Quickly Ashley covered her sleeping boyfriend with a large comforter.
"I hope she's alright." Pete exclaimed.
"What happened?" Mr Stevens asked.
"She was just really out of it at the beginning of the game. I fed her a hotdog and she seemed fine. Just about near the end of the game, she got sick all over the women's room floor, so I carried her to the car and we left." Pete explained.
"I'm sure she'll be fine, I'll let you know tomorrow once she wakes up, but for now, lets just let her sleep." Ashley said trying to get the guys out for the night.
Mr Steven's grabbed his briefcase and followed Pete to the door.
"I really hate to bring this up right now Ashley, but is there anyway you could come into the office tomorrow? I know your daughter isn't feeling well but maybe your sister could come over and stay with her neice for a few hours." Mr. Stevens explained.
"Oh I don't know Patrick. I feel really bad that she got sick at the game, I just want to make sure she's ok." Ashley replied still trying to end the evening.
"Ok, well could you please at least call me, I have the Dazzle Me group coming in and I wanted to show them some of your ideas, but it would be better if you were with me." He replied.
Ashley knew the meeting tomorrow was important. She wanted to be there, but she also wanted to be there for her boyfriend. "I'll let you know first thing in the morning, ok?" She said.
"Fair enough, once again, Thank you again for a wonderful work session. Again, I gotta tell you...you amaze me and I'm excited to see where this contract is going." Mr STevens said. Then continued and added, "Among other things" He said as rubbed Ashley's hand.
Ashley blushed and thanked her boss and then closed the door behind them.
Ashley saw her sleeping boyfriend and walked over to him. She tried to undress him to make him feel more comfortable while he slept but her sister and her had jammed the zipper of the hoodie really well and there was no way she was getting it opened tonight.
She sat on the end of the couch and looked at him. "Is that lipstick?" She thought.
Then leaned over and grabbed a tissue and wiped Sam's lips. Sure enough, it was her color that Sam had used.
She wondered how it came about that he put that on.
She got up and shut off the lights and went to lay down in her bed.

The next morning Ashley crept by her sleeping boyfriend on the couch and grabbed the phone.
She was already fully dressed in her work clothes and was ready to go.
She tiptoed her way into the bathroom and locked the door. Quickly she turned on the shower to make some noise, and then dialed the phone.
On the other end of the line, Ashley's sister Pam picked up the phone.
"Morning!" She answered.
Ashley whispered into the phone. "Pam, I have to ask you for a big favor."
"What's up?" She asked.
Aslhey swallowed hard. "Can you come and sit with Sam for awhile. I have to go into work. It's really important and.."
"Sure" Pam interupted Ashley's rant.
Ashley stopped and heard her sister already say yes. "Oh! I thought you'd put up a little fight being that you aren't too fond of Sam." Ashley replied.
"Well, you are correct and the only reason that I'm saying yes is because you're going to be spending the day with Patrick." She explained.
"Pam, you know I'm staying with Sam and nothing is ever going to ruin that. Patrick and I work together, and plus, he's my boss." Ashley explained to her sister.
Pam sighed on the phone, "Ok, so what time are you going into work?"
"Well, I kind of needed you now, if possible?"Ashley said, hoping that it was ok.
"Well, I'm getting coffee and I'm just down the road. I'm curious though, why can't you just leave him a note and he'll get it when he wakes up?" Pam asked.
"Well being that he's dressed the way that he is, I was hoping you could come over and kind of get him out of the hoodie and bra and other stuff before he woke up." Ashley again hesitantly explained.
"You go, I'll take care of Sam, just leave the door unlocked and I'll get him changed. Don't worry about anything." Pam replied.
"Oh you are the best sis. I'm leaving now. Thanks again. I'll call you before I come home." Ashley said as she hung up her phone and grabbed her purse and car keys and ran out the door.

Pam got in the car with her coffee and started her car. Before she drove she dialed another number.
"Hi, I'd like to make an appointment this morning...."

155332222122122121221112.content:
Sam stirred on the couch. He had been laying on his arm and it was asleep. He turned over to try and get the blood flowing in it again.
He swallowed and felt the sore throat yet again. He opened his eyes and saw Pam, Ashley's sister sitting on the other end of the couch where his feet were stretched. She startled him.

He still couldn't speak, "What the hell are you doing here?" He mouthed to her.

"Aww, still can't talk? That's a shame." she replied leaning over to the side table next to the couch.
On the table was a full shot of Nyquil. She leaned back toward Sam and handing him the full shot.

Sam, who's throat was still really sore didn't quiestion the dosage and swallowed the whole shot down.
Pam had the Nyquil bottle in her hand as Sam handed the dosage cup back to Pam.
Once he handed it back to her, she started filling it back up to the rim.
"Maybe you beter take one more for good measure." She said as she handed Sam another full shot of the nighttime medicine.

Sam took the shot and afterward Pam handed him a can of Sprite with a straw.
Sam immediately started sucking down the can.

"Ashley asked me to come over and stay with you so that you wouldn't be alone." Pam explained.
Sam rolled his eyes and then rolled over on the couch facing the other way.

"Oh no you don't" Pam began. Sam lifted his head to see what Pam was saying.
"I have errends to run today and you're going to come with me." Pam continued.

Sam put his head back down.
"Come on! Get up!" Pam demanded as she stood up off the couch.
She pulled the blanket that was draped over Sam away. Once again Sam looked up at her.

"What the hell?" He mouthed.
"I said, I'm running errends today and you're going with me." She again repeated.
Sam had a scared look on his face. On the one hand, he was still feeling really sick, but on the other hand, he was a little scared of Pam.
She was bigger than he was and she looked like she meant buisness.
Sam draped his legs off the couch and slowly sat up.
He looked around the coffee table and found a piece of memo paper and a pen.
He started writing something with Pam still hovering above him, waiting to read what he wrote.

He handed the paper to Pam.
She grabbed it and read it. It said, "I didn't even shower"

Pam laughed. "Well, lucky for you the first stop is the salon, I need my nails done and I'll have them wash your hair there" she said.
Sam wrote again onto another memo pad paper. Once again he handed it to Pam.

"Just a wash though, NO HAIRCUT!" He wrote in big letters.
Sam didn't care about having his hair washed at the salon. As long as they didn't cut it, he was fine.
Pam stood behind Sam and grabbed the hat from his head. It pulled Sam back onto the couch.
Sam worded, "HEY!"
"Oh calm down. I just wanted that thing off so I can pull back your hair.
Pam took a scrunchie and pulled back Sam's hair into a high ponytail.
When she was finished Sam got up and immediately folded his arms and began to shiver. He was still really sick.
He looked down and saw that he still had on the stuck hoodie. His chest was still pushed out from the layers of undershirts that Ashley told him she wrapped him in. He tried to once again unzipper the zipper that was jammed.
Pam saw that Sam was trying to unzipper it.
"I tried while you were asleep to get that thing off." She explained.
He again made the breasts motion as he grabbed at his chest.
Pam laughed, "It does look like you have breasts. Maybe they can try something at the salon. Come on, we have to go. It's just about time for my appointment." Pam rushed him.

Sam looked around the room for his shoes.
"What are you doing now?" She asked.
Sam pointed at his feet.
"Come on. We don't have time for this." Pam was starting to get angry.
Sam was looking under the couch, under the blankets, and all around the living room for his shoes.
Pam smiled slightly. She had hidden Sam's shoes while he slept. She had placed a pair of Ashley's heeled sandals in the doorway. She leaned over and picked them up.
She handed the pair to Sam.
"Please Sam, I'm going to be late just put these on." She said.

Sam looked at Ashley's sandals. THey had flowers on them and the back of the heel was raised a little.
He made a face of disgust and then tried handing them back to Pam.
Pam refused to grab the sandals as the two started pushing them back and forth.
Finally Pam had enough and yelled at Sam. "PUT THE DAMN SHOES ON!"
Sam couldn't believe Pam got that angry but again, Sam was a still a little scared, so he threw the shoes on the floor and then guided his foot into both sandals.

"Finally, now come on!" she said as she rushed Sam out the door and closed it behind him.
Pam rushed Sam to her car. He was having a hard time walking in Ashley's sandals. Pam just smiled and laughed to herself at how much taller she was than Sam even in a slight heel.

Pam started the car and drove like a maniac down the main street.
Sam put on his shades, as Pam noticed that the Nyquil looked like it was starting to hit him. His head bobbed a few times during the drive, but he ended up making it there without falling asleep.
Pam parked the car and then walked with Sam through the front door of the salon.
"Hello Pamela, you're just in time." The front receptionist said.
Sam was really starting to get lightheaded, cause he went straight for the waiting room chairs and plopped down in it.
Pam approached the front desk.
"Who's the kid?" The woman asked.
Pam leaned in as she signed herself and Sam's name on the registry.
She made sure to put "Samantha" down.
"That's my sister's daughter Samantha. My niece." She explained. She looked over at Sam to see if she heard anything that she had sad, but now Sam was asleep.

"Oh she's cute. What are we going to do for her today?" The woman asked.

"She's a bit of a Tomboy, her mother would really like to see her more feminine," Pam said. "She's at that awkward stage where she doesn't know quite what she wants."

Pam glanced back at Sam, who murmured sleepily in the chair. "She's starting to notice, and be noticed by boys. So, it's time for her to get pretty. Just do what you think she needs. You have free resign on her look."

P turned to go back to Sam, stopped and turned back to the receptionist. "Oh," Pam said. "One other thing. She may complain a little about her makeover. Ignore her. This is for her own good. She was actually complaining about having to wear those sandals."

The receptionist smiled. "Oh, I get it. I have a niece her age as well. It just took a little nudge to get her from high tops and jeans to makeup and miniskirts.

"Well, not to worry. Our beauticians and stylists will make her gorgeous! I'll call you when we're ready for her."

Pam chuckled to herself as she walked back over to where Sam was dozing. She grabbed his hand and patted it. "We're all set, You're on for a treat!"

"Whatever," Sam said. "Can I sleep through it?"

"If you want," Pam said. "That may be for the best. But I'm not sure it will be possible.."

"Challenge accepted," Sam mumbled as he nodded off again.

It only took a few more minutes for the receptionist to call, "Pamela? Samantha? We're ready for you now!"

"C'mon," Pam said as she nudged Sam back awake. "They're ready for us."

The receptionist guided the pair into the back where she gesture to Pam. "You're in here..." and then to Sam, "And you're in here. Enjoy your day!" And with that, she went back to the front desk.

Once they were secured and properly shaped, Tricia painted them a bright shade of pink.
